    <item>
      <title>Dinosaurs and Decolonizing Paleontology w/ Aline Ghilardi, Juan Cisneros, &amp; Tito Aureliano</title>
      <itunes:title>Dinosaurs and Decolonizing Paleontology w/ Aline Ghilardi, Juan Cisneros, &amp;amp; Tito Aureliano</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 15 Sep 2023 04:58:06 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[a0d3334a-3174-4f29-ab4a-666402e6d631]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/dinosaurs-and-decolonizing-paleontology-w-aline-ghilardi-juan-cisneros-tito-aureliano]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<div dir="auto"> <div dir="auto"> <p class="p1">In this episode of Guerrilla History, we have a fascinating discussion alongside three wonderful paleontologists based in Brazil about efforts to decolonize paleontology and restitute stolen fossils.  These three have written some great articles on this topic, such as <a href= "https://www.nature.com/articles/s41559-021-01588-9">The moral and legal imperative to return illegally exported fossils</a>, <a href= "https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34969991/">Colonial history and global economics distort our understanding of deep-time biodiversity</a>, and <a href= "https://royalsocietypublishing.org/doi/10.1098/rsos.210898#d1e1655"> Digging deeper into colonial palaeontological practices in modern day Mexico and Brazil</a>.  This is a crucial conversation, and one which we feel doesn't get nearly enough attention even within political circles like the one we operate in.  #IrritatorBelongstoBr</p> </div> </div> <div dir="auto">Aline Ghilardi is an Associate Professor in the Department of Geology at UFRN.  You can find the work that her (and Tito's) paleontology lab does at the website <a href= "en.dinolab.com.br">en.dinolab.com.br</a>.  Aline can be followed on twitter <a href= "twitter.com/alinemghilardi">@alinemghilardi</a></div> <div dir="auto"> </div> <div dir="auto">Juan Cisneros is a paleontologist and an Associate Professor in the Department of Geology at UFPI twitter <a href="twitter.com/PaleoCisneros">@PaleoCisneros</a>.</div> <div dir="auto"> </div> <div dir="auto">Tito Aureliano is an Associate Researcher at DINOlab in the Department of Geology at UFRN.  His work can be viewed at the same website linked in Aline's bio above.  In addition, Tito and Aline co-run a multimedia science communication project titled <a href= "https://www.colecionadoresdeossos.com/?lang=en">Colecionadores De Ossos (Bone Collectors)</a>, which includes a YouTube channel, books, comics, and even a video game!  Tito can be followed on twitter <a href= "twitter.com/tito_aureliano">@tito_aureliano</a></div> <div dir="auto"> </div> <div dir="auto">Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory" target="_blank" rel= "noopener" data-saferedirecturl= "https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory&source=gmail&ust=1683964557249000&usg=AOvVaw30MsLjFab_1zdkL_I2ZKm2"> https://www.patreon.com/<wbr />guerrillahistory</a></div>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1">In this episode of Guerrilla History, we have a fascinating discussion alongside three wonderful paleontologists based in Brazil about efforts to decolonize paleontology and restitute stolen fossils. These three have written some great articles on this topic, such as <a href= "https://www.nature.com/articles/s41559-021-01588-9">The moral and legal imperative to return illegally exported fossils</a>, <a href= "https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/34969991/">Colonial history and global economics distort our understanding of deep-time biodiversity</a>, and <a href= "https://royalsocietypublishing.org/doi/10.1098/rsos.210898#d1e1655"> Digging deeper into colonial palaeontological practices in modern day Mexico and Brazil</a>. This is a crucial conversation, and one which we feel doesn't get nearly enough attention even within political circles like the one we operate in. #IrritatorBelongstoBr</p> Aline Ghilardi is an Associate Professor in the Department of Geology at UFRN. You can find the work that her (and Tito's) paleontology lab does at the website <a href= "en.dinolab.com.br">en.dinolab.com.br</a>. Aline can be followed on twitter <a href= "twitter.com/alinemghilardi">@alinemghilardi</a> Juan Cisneros is a paleontologist and an Associate Professor in the Department of Geology at UFPI twitter <a href="twitter.com/PaleoCisneros">@PaleoCisneros</a>. Tito Aureliano is an Associate Researcher at DINOlab in the Department of Geology at UFRN. His work can be viewed at the same website linked in Aline's bio above. In addition, Tito and Aline co-run a multimedia science communication project titled <a href= "https://www.colecionadoresdeossos.com/?lang=en">Colecionadores De Ossos (Bone Collectors)</a>, which includes a YouTube channel, books, comics, and even a video game! Tito can be followed on twitter <a href= "twitter.com/tito_aureliano">@tito_aureliano</a> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory" target="_blank" rel= "noopener" data-saferedirecturl= "https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory&source=gmail&ust=1683964557249000&usg=AOvVaw30MsLjFab_1zdkL_I2ZKm2"> https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>Why Turkey Is Authoritarian w/ Halil Karaveli [REMASTERED]</title>
      <itunes:title>Why Turkey Is Authoritarian w/ Halil Karaveli [REMASTERED]</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 08 Sep 2023 09:05:15 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[806fc678-ae13-4048-82b1-7552e46997c8]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/why-turkey-is-authoritarian-w-halil-karaveli-remastered]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>This episode is a fully-remastered edition of a previous episode we released, where we brought on Halil Karaveli to talk about Why Turkey Is Authoritarian. This discussion was our second interview ever on the show, and while the format of the show has slightly changed over the last few years, this was really a tremendous discussion about an important work and topic.  If you didn't catch this episode when it first came out, or if it has been a few years since you have listened to it, be sure to check it out!</p> <p>Halil M. Karaveli is a Senior Fellow with the Turkey Center of the Central Asia-Caucasus Institute & Silk Road Studies Program Joint Center and editor of its publication <a href= "https://www.turkeyanalyst.org/">The Turkey Analyst</a>.  His book <a href= "https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745337555/why-turkey-is-authoritarian/"> Why Turkey Is Authoritarian:  From Atatürk to Erdoğan</a> is available from Pluto Books.</p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content:</span> <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> </span></p> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;"> <div       <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This episode is a fully-remastered edition of a previous episode we released, where we brought on Halil Karaveli to talk about Why Turkey Is Authoritarian. This discussion was our second interview ever on the show, and while the format of the show has slightly changed over the last few years, this was really a tremendous discussion about an important work and topic. If you didn't catch this episode when it first came out, or if it has been a few years since you have listened to it, be sure to check it out!</p> <p>Halil M. Karaveli is a Senior Fellow with the Turkey Center of the Central Asia-Caucasus Institute & Silk Road Studies Program Joint Center and editor of its publication <a href= "https://www.turkeyanalyst.org/">The Turkey Analyst</a>. His book <a href= "https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745337555/why-turkey-is-authoritarian/"> Why Turkey Is Authoritarian: From Atatürk to Erdoğan</a> is available from Pluto Books.</p> <p> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>Empire and the Deep State - American Exception w/ Aaron Good</title>
      <itunes:title>Empire and the Deep State - American Exception w/ Aaron Good</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 01 Sep 2023 17:28:16 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[8ca458d0-cf7f-48ed-b958-b6b78a09f5b2]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/empire-and-the-deep-state-american-exception-w-aaron-good]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this fascinating and fun episode, Aaron Good comes on the show to discuss his book <a href= "https://www.skyhorsepublishing.com/9781510769144/american-exception/"> American Exception: Empire and the Deep State</a>.  This is a great conversation which focuses on Aaron's conceptualizing of exceptionism and how the American Empire works.  This topic is critical for us, as the concept of "the Deep State" has been distorted by the right-wing, and obscures the workings of the actual Deep State here within the belly of the beast.  </p> <p>Aaron Good has a PhD in Political Science from Temple University. His dissertation, "American Exception: Hegemony and the Tripartite State," examined the state, elite criminality, and US hegemony.  His book <a href= "https://www.skyhorsepublishing.com/9781510769144/american-exception/"> American Exception: Empire and the Deep State</a> is available from Skyhorse Publishers, and he has a website and podcast of the same name which can be found at <a href= "https://americanexception.com/">https://americanexception.com/</a>.  Aaron can be followed on twitter <a href= "twitter.com/Aaron_Good_">@Aaron_Good_</a>.</p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content:</span> <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> </span></p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this fascinating and fun episode, Aaron Good comes on the show to discuss his book <a href= "https://www.skyhorsepublishing.com/9781510769144/american-exception/"> American Exception: Empire and the Deep State</a>. This is a great conversation which focuses on Aaron's conceptualizing of exceptionism and how the American Empire works. This topic is critical for us, as the concept of "the Deep State" has been distorted by the right-wing, and obscures the workings of the actual Deep State here within the belly of the beast. </p> <p>Aaron Good has a PhD in Political Science from Temple University. His dissertation, "American Exception: Hegemony and the Tripartite State," examined the state, elite criminality, and US hegemony. His book <a href= "https://www.skyhorsepublishing.com/9781510769144/american-exception/"> American Exception: Empire and the Deep State</a> is available from Skyhorse Publishers, and he has a website and podcast of the same name which can be found at <a href= "https://americanexception.com/">https://americanexception.com/</a>. Aaron can be followed on twitter <a href= "twitter.com/Aaron_Good_">@Aaron_Good_</a>.</p> <p> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>Why Anti-Racism Means Anti-Capitalism w/ Arun Kundnani</title>
      <itunes:title>Why Anti-Racism Means Anti-Capitalism w/ Arun Kundnani</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 25 Aug 2023 12:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[1a418758-47e0-42c5-97c4-de5c44e1f529]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/why-anti-racism-means-anti-capitalism-w-arun-kundnani]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this important episode, Arun Kundnani comes on the show to discuss his new book <a href= "https://www.versobooks.com/products/2670-what-is-antiracism">What Is Antiracism?: <span class="c-product-detail__subtitle">And Why It Means Anticapitalism</span></a>.  This is a fascinating discussion that focuses on liberal vs. radical conceptions of antiracism, and why liberal antiracism has proven powerless against structural oppression.  This topic is important for us to think about as we build movements that tackle all forms of oppression, including racial oppression.  </p> <p>Arun Kundnani has been active in antiracist movements in Britain and the United States for three decades. He is a former editor of the journal <em>Race & Class</em> and was a scholar-in-residence at the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture at the New York Public Library.  His website can be found at <a href= "https://www.kundnani.org/">https://www.kundnani.org/</a> and you can follow him on Twitter @<a href= "twitter.com/ArunKundnani">@ArunKundnani</a>.</p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content:</span> <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> </span></p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this important episode, Arun Kundnani comes on the show to discuss his new book <a href= "https://www.versobooks.com/products/2670-what-is-antiracism">What Is Antiracism?: And Why It Means Anticapitalism</a>. This is a fascinating discussion that focuses on liberal vs. radical conceptions of antiracism, and why liberal antiracism has proven powerless against structural oppression. This topic is important for us to think about as we build movements that tackle all forms of oppression, including racial oppression. </p> <p>Arun Kundnani has been active in antiracist movements in Britain and the United States for three decades. He is a former editor of the journal <em>Race & Class</em> and was a scholar-in-residence at the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture at the New York Public Library. His website can be found at <a href= "https://www.kundnani.org/">https://www.kundnani.org/</a> and you can follow him on Twitter @<a href= "twitter.com/ArunKundnani">@ArunKundnani</a>.</p> <p> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>The Military vs. the Planet - Earth's Greatest Enemy w/ Mike Prysner</title>

      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we are joined by Mike Prysner to discuss the devastating impact of the US military, and the forthcoming documentary that Mike and Abby Martin are putting together on this topic titled <a href= "https://earthsgreatestenemy.com/">Earth's Greatest Enemy</a> (<a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rphBWk15_h4">watch the trailer here</a>)!       <title>Sources and Methods - Psychedelic Remote Viewing w/ Brandon Wolfe-Hunnicutt</title>
      <itunes:title>Sources and Methods - Psychedelic Remote Viewing w/ Brandon Wolfe-Hunnicutt</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 11 Aug 2023 16:28:07 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[7a50c2a3-9bb7-496f-ba4d-2f8f10764cbb]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/sources-and-methods-psychedelic-remote-viewing-w-brandon-wolfe-hunnicutt]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on a returning fan favorite, Prof. Brandon Wolfe-Hunnicutt, for an episode on sources and methods within history - including discussion of a method Brandon dubs psychedelic remote viewing. This conversation is certainly one that will please those interested in HOW history is done, and how we should view various sources used within historiographic analysis!  It sounds super nerdy, and it kind of is, but we're sure you're going to love the conversation! </p> <p>Brandon Wolfe-Hunnicutt is a historian at California State University, Stanislas.  You can (and should!) get <a href= "https://www.sup.org/books/title/?id=26330"><em>The Paranoid Style in American Diplomacy: Oil and Arab Nationalism in Iraq</em></a> from Stanford University Press.  He can be followed on twitter <a href="twitter.com/HunnicuttWolfe">@HunnicuttWolfe</a></p> <p>Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a></p>]]></description>

      <title>Save the History of Africa &amp; the African Diaspora MRes! w/ Hakim Adi</title>
      <itunes:title>Save the History of Africa &amp;amp; the African Diaspora MRes! w/ Hakim Adi</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 04 Aug 2023 14:11:18 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[9983a4e0-0d82-4457-a1b9-f67a79dbd2e8]]></guid>

      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this pressing episode, we bring on the esteemed Professor Hakim Adi to discuss the MRes History of Africa & the African Diaspora program, and the University of Chichester's efforts to shut down the program and make Professor Adi redundant.  This is an incredibly important issue that we take up, so listeners, take action.  Sign <a href= "https://www.change.org/p/stop-university-of-chichester-s-axing-of-the-mres-history-of-africa-the-african-diaspora"> this petition</a> NOW to tell the University of Chichester to preserve the MRes program and maintain Professor Adi in his role, then write a comment on the petition and forward it to 5 comrades!  Tag us in any tweets you make about the petition, we will boost your message!  Once again, sign and share the petition at <a href= "https://www.change.org/p/stop-university-of-chichester-s-axing-of-the-mres-history-of-africa-the-african-diaspora"> https://www.change.org/p/stop-university-of-chichester-s-axing-of-the-mres-history-of-africa-the-african-diaspora</a>.</p> <p>Hakim Adi is Professor of the History of Africa and the African Diaspora at University of Chichester, and the founder of <a href= "https://www.historymatters.online/journal">History Matters and its affiliated journal</a>.  He has authored numerous <a href= "hakimadi.org/publications">books</a>, and has written many articles which can be found on his website <a href= "hakimadi.org">hakimadi.org</a>.  You can follow him on twitter <a href="twitter.com/hakimadi1">@hakimadi1</a></p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content:</span> <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a><span style="font-family: -apple-system,     <item>
      <title>Weaponizing Antisemitism w/ Asa Winstanley</title>
      <itunes:title>Weaponizing Antisemitism w/ Asa Winstanley</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 28 Jul 2023 12:58:27 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[f8d1a921-2661-4dc9-af6b-9aec10a5d8f0]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/weaponizing-antisemitism-w-asa-winstanley]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this excellent episode, we bring on Asa Winstanley to discuss his new book <a href= "https://www.orbooks.com/catalog/weaponising-anti-semitism/">Weaponising Anti-Semitism: How the Israel Lobby Brought Down Jeremy Corbyn</a>.  This conversation is a fantastic work of recent history, and also is an important study for those of us active in the Palestine solidarity movement.  Be sure to listen closely, grab yourself a copy of the book, and let others know about the episode!</p> <p>Asa Winstanley has been writing about Palestine and the Israel lobby since 2005. He spent two years living under Israeli occupation in the West Bank as an activist and writer. He has been an associate editor and reporter with the award-winning website <a href="https://electronicintifada.net/">The Electronic Intifada</a> for more than a decade.</p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content:</span> <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> </span></p>]]></description>

    <item>
      <title>Climate Breakdown, Sovereignty, &amp; the "Anthropocene" - IB</title>
      <itunes:title>Climate Breakdown, Sovereignty, &amp;amp; the &quot;Anthropocene&quot; - IB</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 21 Jul 2023 12:55:17 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[e50c698f-b807-4edc-b7c4-36ee36cf7753]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/climate-breakdown-sovereignty-the-anthropocene-ib]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this Intelligence Briefing, Adnan and Henry discuss some of the latest regarding the ongoing climate breakdown and discussions of the "Anthropocene", weaving in discussion of sovereignty, techno-modernism, the Capitalocene, and much more. </p> <p>This is the latest in our series of episodes focused on the environment and climate, be sure to check out our previous episodes on <a href= "https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/a-history-of-the-world-in-7-cheap-things-w-jason-w-moore-raj-patel">A History of the World in 7 Cheap Things</a> (w/ Jason W. Moore & Raj Patel), <a href= "https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/world-ecology-and-the-capitalocene-w-jason-moore">World Ecology & the Capitalocene</a> (w/ Jason W. Moore), <a href= "https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/shut-down-red-hill-naval-pollution-disaster-w-mikey-from-oahu-water-protectors-dispatch">Shut Down Red Hill! Naval Pollution Disaster</a> (w/ Mikey from O'ahu Water Protectors), <a href= "https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/salvatore">Socialist States and the Environment</a>  (w/ Salvatore Engel-Di Mauro), <a href= "https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/cop26-dispatch-w-vijay-prashad-and-chris-saltmarsh">COP26 Dispatch</a>  (w/ Vijay Prashad & Chris Saltmarsh), and <a href= "https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/eco-despair-revolutionary-optimism-and-the-fight-for-the-future-part-1-intelligence-briefing">Eco-Despair, Revolutionary Optimism, and the Fight for the Future</a>.  </p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content:</span> <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> </span></p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this Intelligence Briefing, Adnan and Henry discuss some of the latest regarding the ongoing climate breakdown and discussions of the "Anthropocene", weaving in discussion of sovereignty, techno-modernism, the Capitalocene, and much more. </p> <p>This is the latest in our series of episodes focused on the environment and climate, be sure to check out our previous episodes on <a href= "https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/a-history-of-the-world-in-7-cheap-things-w-jason-w-moore-raj-patel">A History of the World in 7 Cheap Things</a> (w/ Jason W.       <title>Freedom or Martyrdom – Walid Daqqah's fate is in our hands w/ Jeanine and Thawra from the Palestinian Youth Movement</title>
      <itunes:title>Freedom or Martyrdom – Walid Daqqah&#39;s fate is in our hands w/ Jeanine and Thawra from the Palestinian Youth Movement</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 14 Jul 2023 12:36:08 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[ec7c77fe-4a56-43d6-88af-14a5d55f69ce]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/freedom-or-martyrdom-walid-daqqahs-fate-is-in-our-hands-w-jeanine-and-thawra-from-the-palestinian-youth-movement]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>Today we are cross-publishing our latest Guerrilla Radio spinoff episode, to ensure as many of our listeners can take part in the action to free Walid Daqqah as possible.  Be sure to spread the word!</p> <hr /> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> In this high-priority episode of Guerrilla Radio, we are joined by Jeanine and Thawra from the Palestinian Youth Movement to bring light to their current campaign for the urgent and immediate release of the Palestinian political prisoner Walid Daqqah, and the history, centrality, and role the Prisoners Movement plays in the struggle for national liberation. </span></p> <p>The Palestinian Youth Movement calls on the international community to demand the immediate release of Walid Daqqah and expose the illegal nature of his imprisonment.</p> <p>Link to the petition: <a href= "https://palestinianyouthmovement.com/free-walid-daqqah" target= "_blank" rel= "noopener">https://palestinianyouthmovement.com/free-walid-daqqah</a><br />  Link to the toolkit: <a href= "noopener">https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Vw3YvXsB_pCVm2OJzyrOIFNL2OE5VojForV8gmQ60T8/edit</a></p> <p>Check PYM's social media for actions happening near you: </p> <p>IG: palestinianyouthmovement       <title>Stalin: History &amp; Critique of a Black Legend w/ Salvatore Engel-Di Mauro &amp; David Peat</title>
      <itunes:title>Stalin: History &amp;amp; Critique of a Black Legend w/ Salvatore Engel-Di Mauro &amp;amp; David Peat</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 07 Jul 2023 10:30:29 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[1e39faff-e942-4b7a-9766-ac9cb2a462fd]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/stalin-history-critique-of-a-black-legend-w-salvatore-engel-di-mauro-david-peat]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>Special, early access to an extended conversation about the imminent release of the new translation (by <a href= "twitter.com/huck1995">Henry</a> and Salvatore) of Domenico Losurdo's <em>Stalin: History and Critique of a Black Legend</em> from Iskra Books.  The release of the book is imminent, and is available from the <a href="https://www.iskrabooks.org/" "https://www.iskrabooks.org/copy-of-the-dark">https://www.iskrabooks.org/copy-of-the-dark</a>.</p> <p>Salvatore Engel-Di Mauro is Professor at the Geography Department of SUNY New Paltz and is chief editor for the journal <em>Capitalism Nature Socialism</em>.  His book <em>Socialist States and the Environment</em> is available from Pluto Press: <a href= "https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745340418/socialist-states-and-the-environment/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow environmental perspectives: <a href="http://www.cnsjournal.org/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener">http://www.cnsjournal.org/</a>.</p> <p>David Peat is one of the editorial board members at the Center for Communist Studies and their imprint <a href= "https://www.iskrabooks.org/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">Iskra Books</a>.  You can follow him on twitter <a href="https://twitter.com/dajveism" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">@dajveism</a>.</p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content:</span> <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> </span></p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Special, early access to an extended conversation about the imminent release of the new translation (by <a href= "twitter.com/huck1995">Henry</a> and Salvatore) of Domenico Losurdo's <em>Stalin: History and Critique of a Black Legend</em> from Iskra Books. The release of the book is imminent, and is available from the <a href="https://www.iskrabooks.org/" target= "_blank" rel="nofollow noopener">Iskra Books website</a>, where it is currently linked at <a href= "https://www.iskrabooks.org/copy-of-the-dark">https://www.iskrabooks.org/copy-of-the-dark</a>.</p> <p>Salvatore Engel-Di Mauro is Professor at the Geography Department of SUNY New Paltz and is chief editor for the journal <em>Capitalism Nature Socialism</em>. His book <em>Socialist States and the Environment</em> is available from Pluto Press: <a href= "https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745340418/socialist-states-and-the-environment/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener"> https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745340418/socialist-states-and-the-environment/</a>.       <title>Trying to Unbalance Russia - Sanctions on Russia w/ Jeremy Kuzmarov</title>
      <itunes:title>Trying to Unbalance Russia - Sanctions on Russia w/ Jeremy Kuzmarov</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 30 Jun 2023 15:07:07 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[f1bfc2d7-770a-40a7-9cb7-e9865bbf85cd]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/trying-to-unbalance-russia-sanctions-on-russia-w-jeremy-kuzmarov]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>This episode of Guerrilla History is a continuation of our Sanctions As War miniseries (get the book <a href= "https://www.haymarketbooks.org/books/2024-sanctions-as-war">here</a>).  In this timely episode, we bring on the Jeremy Kuzmarov to discuss the history and unfolding situation regarding sanctions on Russia.  This episode is as timely now as it ever has been. Be sure to get the word out and share this with comrades involved in the anti-sanctions movement.</p> <div class="page" title="Page 12"> <div class="layoutArea"> <div class="column"> <div class="page" title="Page 14"> <div class="layoutArea"> <div class="column"> <p>Jeremy Kuzmarov is Managing Editor of <a href= "https://covertactionmagazine.com/"><em>CovertAction Magazine</em></a> and is author of four books on US foreign policy including <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Myth-Addicted-Army-Vietnam-Politics/dp/1558497056/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1531338124&sr=8-3&keywords=Jeremy+Kuzmarov"><em>The Myth of the Addicted Army</em></a> (Massachusetts, 2009); <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Modernizing-Repression-Training-Nation-Building-American/dp/1558499172/ref=sr_1_1?keywords=Modernizing+Repression%3A+Police+Training+and+Nation-Building+in+the+American+Century&qid=1565361291&s=gateway&sr=8-1"><em>Modernizing Repression</em></a> (Massachusetts, 2012); <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Russians-Are-Coming-Again-Tragedy-ebook/dp/B07C598L87/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1531338124&sr=8-2&keywords=Jeremy+Kuzmarov"><em>The Russians are Coming, Again</em></a>, with John Marciano (New York: Monthly Review Press, 2018) and <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Obamas-Unending-Wars-Fronting-Permanent/dp/1949762009/ref=sr_1_1?keywords=OBAMA%E2%80%99S+UNENDING+WARS&qid=1565272375&s=gateway&sr=8-1"><em>Obama's Unending Wars</em></a> (Atlanta: Clarity Press, 2019).  You can stay up to date with his work by checking out his website at <a href= "https://jeremykuzmarov.com/">https://jeremykuzmarov.com/</a></p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content:</span> <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href=       <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This episode of Guerrilla History is a continuation of our Sanctions As War miniseries (get the book <a href= "https://www.haymarketbooks.org/books/2024-sanctions-as-war">here</a>). In this timely episode, we bring on the Jeremy Kuzmarov to discuss the history and unfolding situation regarding sanctions on Russia. This episode is as timely now as it ever has been. Be sure to get the word out and share this with comrades involved in the anti-sanctions movement.</p> <p>Jeremy Kuzmarov is Managing Editor of <a href= "https://covertactionmagazine.com/"><em>CovertAction Magazine</em></a> and is author of four books on US foreign policy including <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Myth-Addicted-Army-Vietnam-Politics/dp/1558497056/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1531338124&sr=8-3&keywords=Jeremy+Kuzmarov"><em>The Myth of the Addicted Army</em></a> (Massachusetts, 2009); <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Modernizing-Repression-Training-Nation-Building-American/dp/1558499172/ref=sr_1_1?keywords=Modernizing+Repression%3A+Police+Training+and+Nation-Building+in+the+American+Century&qid=1565361291&s=gateway&sr=8-1"><em>Modernizing Repression</em></a> (Massachusetts, 2012); <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Russians-Are-Coming-Again-Tragedy-ebook/dp/B07C598L87/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1531338124&sr=8-2&keywords=Jeremy+Kuzmarov"><em>The Russians are Coming, Again</em></a>, with John Marciano (New York: Monthly Review Press, 2018) and <a href= "https://www.amazon.com/Obamas-Unending-Wars-Fronting-Permanent/dp/1949762009/ref=sr_1_1?keywords=OBAMA%E2%80%99S+UNENDING+WARS&qid=1565272375&s=gateway&sr=8-1"><em>Obama's Unending Wars</em></a> (Atlanta: Clarity Press, 2019). You can stay up to date with his work by checking out his website at <a href= "https://jeremykuzmarov.com/">https://jeremykuzmarov.com/</a></p> <p> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>Stand with Cuba Against the State Sponsors of Terrorism List w/ Calla Walsh &amp; Jorge Rocha</title>
      <itunes:title>Stand with Cuba Against the State Sponsors of Terrorism List w/ Calla Walsh &amp;amp; Jorge Rocha</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 23 Jun 2023 09:39:37 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[c2e0d300-b36a-49d5-b96d-12eb36d588f2]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/stand-with-cuba-against-the-state-sponsors-of-terrorism-list-w-calla-walsh-jorge-rocha]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this important episode, we discuss some real-world efforts to stand in solidarity with Cuba by the National Network on Cuba, as well as how Cuba's placement on the State Sponsors of Terrorism List is a complete sham that continues to hurt the Cuban people.  Be sure to connect with NNOC, and take part in their J<a href="https://nnoc.org/offthelist-campaign/">une 25 Weekend of Action</a>!  Find out more by checking out their <a href= "https://nnoc.org/">website</a> or following them on twitter <a href="twitter.com/NNOCuba">@NNOCuba</a>.</p> <p>Calla Walsh is a cochair of the National Network on Cuba and was one of their coordinators for the International May Day Brigade.  You can follow her on twitter <a href= "twitter.com/CallaWalsh">@CallaWalsh</a>.</p> <p>Jorge Rocha is on the steering committee for the International Committee of DSA, citywide leadership committee for DSA, and cohost of the podcast <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/everybody-loves-communism/id1577239978"> Everybody Loves Communism</a>. You can follow him on twitter <a href="twitter.com/LineGoesDown">@LineGoesDown</a>.</p> <p>Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this important episode, we discuss some real-world efforts to stand in solidarity with Cuba by the National Network on Cuba, as well as how Cuba's placement on the State Sponsors of Terrorism List is a complete sham that continues to hurt the Cuban people.       <title>Jose Maria Sison: In Conversation with Comrade Joma [REMASTERED]</title>
      <itunes:title>Jose Maria Sison: In Conversation with Comrade Joma [REMASTERED]</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Jun 2023 10:44:12 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[db4b4675-9c89-4f14-b4c3-f3e99c693788]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/jose-maria-sison-in-conversation-with-comrade-joma-remastered]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>This episode is a fully-remastered edition of a previous episode we released, where we brought on the late Professor Jose Maria Sison, better known as Comrade Joma, to talk about his life, how it impacted his ideology, the history of the Communist Party of the Philippines, and more!  Comrade Joma was and is an absolute legendary figure, and it was a pleasure and an honor to be able to talk with him.  A must listen conversation for anyone interested in proletarian struggles and People's War in the Global South, especially the Philippines!</p> <p>Jose Maria Sison was the Founding Chairman of the Communist Party of the Philippines, Chair Emeritus of the International League of People's Struggle, and the Chief Political Consultant of the National Democratic Front of the Philippines.  He had written extensively, a great place to find some of his works is via our friends at Foreign Languages Press.  They have several of his works available for free as pdfs or for affordable print copies on their website <a href= "https://foreignlanguages.press/">https://foreignlanguages.press/</a>. </p> <p>Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory" target="_blank" rel= "noopener" data-saferedirecturl= "https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory&source=gmail&ust=1683964557249000&usg=AOvVaw30MsLjFab_1zdkL_I2ZKm2"> https://www.patreon.com/<wbr />guerrillahistory</a></p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This episode is a fully-remastered edition of a previous episode we released, where we brought on the late Professor Jose Maria Sison, better known as Comrade Joma, to talk about his life, how it impacted his ideology, the history of the Communist Party of the Philippines, and more! Comrade Joma was and is an absolute legendary figure, and it was a pleasure and an honor to be able to talk with him. A must listen conversation for anyone interested in proletarian struggles and People's War in the Global South, especially the Philippines!</p> <p>Jose Maria Sison was the Founding Chairman of the Communist Party of the Philippines, Chair Emeritus of the International League of People's Struggle, and the Chief Political Consultant of the National Democratic Front of the Philippines. He had written extensively, a great place to find some of his works is via our friends at Foreign Languages Press. They have several of his works available for free as pdfs or for affordable print copies on their website <a href= "https://foreignlanguages.press/">https://foreignlanguages.press/</a>. </p> <p>Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory" target="_blank" rel= "noopener" data-saferedirecturl= "https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory&source=gmail&ust=1683964557249000&usg=AOvVaw30MsLjFab_1zdkL_I2ZKm2"> https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a></p>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>Sanctions &amp; Dedollarization (+Cornel West chat) w/ Richard Wolff</title>
      <itunes:title>Sanctions &amp;amp; Dedollarization (+Cornel West chat) w/ Richard Wolff</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 09 Jun 2023 06:02:14 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[67004b68-1c1a-416d-b5e3-cc6f6e559863]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/sanctions-dedollarization-cornel-west-chat-w-richard-wolff]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode, we continue our previous conversation with Professor Richard Wolff about the process of dedollarization and specifically focusing on how this process will impact the United States's ability to sanction anyone they see fit as they see fit, and a brief discussion of Cornel West's Presidential bid.  We then follow up the conversation with an extended wrap-up conversation!</p> <p>Richard Wolff is a Professor Emeritus of Economics at UMass-Amherst and a Visiting Professor at The New School.  He is also the host of <a href= "https://economicupdate.libsyn.com/">Economic Update</a> and the founder of <a href="https://www.democracyatwork.info/">Democracy At Work</a>.  You can follow him on Twitter <a href= "twitter.com/profwolff">@profwolff</a>.  The websites to find his work are <a href="rdwolff.com">rdwolff.com</a> and <a href= "democracyatwork.info">democracyatwork.info</a></p> <p>Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></description>

      <title>History of Sanctions on the DPRK &amp; China w/ Tim Beal</title>
      <itunes:title>History of Sanctions on the DPRK &amp;amp; China w/ Tim Beal</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 02 Jun 2023 07:03:03 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[b62f6dca-a8f2-4311-99d9-b4ffce148744]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/history-of-sanctions-on-the-dprk-china-w-tim-beal]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>This episode of Guerrilla History is a continuation of our Sanctions As War miniseries (get the book <a href= "https://www.haymarketbooks.org/books/2024-sanctions-as-war">here</a>).  In this fascinating episode, we bring on the Tim Beal to discuss the history and ongoing reality of sanctions on the DPRK and China, as well as how these two cases are intimately related.  Get the word out and share this with comrades involved in the anti-sanctions movement.</p> <div class="page" title="Page 12"> <div class="layoutArea"> <div class="column"> <div class="page" title="Page 14"> <div class="layoutArea"> <div class="column"> <p>Tim Beal is a retired New Zealand academic who has written extensively on Asia, particularly on Northeast Asia and US imperialism. Recent publications include the new introduction (alongside our friend <a href="twitter.com/GregoryElich">Gregory Elich</a>) of I.F. Stone's <a href= "https://monthlyreview.org/product/hidden-history-of-the-korean-war-new-edition/"> The Hidden History of the Korean War</a>, 'Korea and Imperialism' (<a href= "https://link.springer.com/referenceworkentry/10.1007/978-3-319-91206-6_92-1"><em>The Palgrave Encyclopedia of Imperialism and Anti-Imperialism</em></a>), and <a href= "https://monthlyreview.org/2021/07/01/in-line-of-fire-the-korean-peninsula-in-u-s-china-strategy/"> 'In Line of Fire: The Korean Peninsula in US-China Strategy' (<em>Monthly Review</em>)</a>.  You can find more of Tim's work by looking at his <a href= "http://www.timbeal.net.nz/">website</a>, especially the section on <a href="http://www.timbeal.net.nz/geopolitics/">Asian Geopolitics</a>.</p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content:</span> <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> </span></p> </div> </div> </div> </div> </div> </div>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This episode of Guerrilla History is a continuation of our Sanctions As War miniseries (get the book <a href= "https://www.haymarketbooks.org/books/2024-sanctions-as-war">here</a>). In this fascinating episode, we bring on the Tim Beal to discuss the history and ongoing reality of sanctions on the DPRK and China, as well as how these two cases are intimately related. Get the word out and share this with comrades involved in the anti-sanctions movement.</p> <p>Tim Beal is a retired New Zealand academic who has written extensively on Asia, particularly on Northeast Asia and US imperialism. Recent publications include the new introduction (alongside our friend <a href="twitter.com/GregoryElich">Gregory Elich</a>) of I.F. Stone's <a href= "https://monthlyreview.org/product/hidden-history-of-the-korean-war-new-edition/"> The Hidden History of the Korean War</a>, 'Korea and Imperialism' (<a href= "https://link.springer.com/referenceworkentry/10.1007/978-3-319-91206-6_92-1"><em>The Palgrave Encyclopedia of Imperialism and Anti-Imperialism</em></a>), and <a href= "https://monthlyreview.org/2021/07/01/in-line-of-fire-the-korean-peninsula-in-u-s-china-strategy/"> 'In Line of Fire: The Korean Peninsula in US-China Strategy' (<em>Monthly Review</em>)</a>. You can find more of Tim's work by looking at his <a href= "http://www.timbeal.net.nz/">website</a>, especially the section on <a href="http://www.timbeal.net.nz/geopolitics/">Asian Geopolitics</a>.</p> <p> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>Sweden's Integration into the Imperialist World System ft/ Torkil Lauesen [REMASTERED]</title>
      <itunes:title>Sweden&#39;s Integration into the Imperialist World System [REMASTERED]</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 26 May 2023 17:05:07 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[c038d778-0d73-4644-aef4-b29740e669ed]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/swedens-integration-into-the-imperialist-world-system-remastered]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>This episode is a fully-remastered edition of a Revolutionary Left Radio episode: Riding the Wave: Sweden's Integration into the Imperialist World System" featuring Torkil Lauesen.  We plan on periodically remastering some of our early episodes and re-releasing them as well, and releasing them one every month or two between our regular episodes.  Stay tuned for that!</p> <p>Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory" target="_blank" rel= "noopener" data-saferedirecturl= "https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory&source=gmail&ust=1683964557249000&usg=AOvVaw30MsLjFab_1zdkL_I2ZKm2"> https://www.patreon.com/<wbr />guerrillahistory</a></p> <hr /> <p>Torkil Lauesen returns to the show, this time to discuss his newest book "Riding the Wave: Sweden's Integration into the Imperialist World Order". Pushing back against the narrative that Nordic countries like Sweden are socialist paradises who don't engage in colonialism and imperialism like other western countries, Torkil dives deep into history to deconstruct this rather naive perspective and offer a historical materialist account of Sweden's actual place in the history of colonialism, capitalism, and imperialism. </p> <p><a href="https://www.patreon.com/huck1995/posts">Henry Hakamaki</a> from <a href= "https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/">Guerrilla History</a> joins Breht for the interview as well! </p> <p>Check out the book here: <a href= "https://www.leftwingbooks.net/book/content/riding-wave-sweden">https://www.leftwingbooks.net/book/content/riding-wave-sweden</a></p> <p>Read more of Torkil's work here: <a href= "https://anti-imperialist.net/author/lauesen/">https://anti-imperialist.net/author/lauesen/</a></p> <p>Outro Music: <em>"I'm the Echo</em><em>"</em> by DARKSIDE</p> <p>-----</p> <p>Support Rev Left Radio: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/RevLeftRadio">https://www.patreon.com/RevLeftRadio</a></p> <p>or make a one time donation: PayPal.me/revleft</p> <p>LEARN MORE ABOUT REV LEFT RADIO: <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">www.revolutionaryleftradio.com</a></p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This episode is a fully-remastered edition of a Revolutionary Left Radio episode: Riding the Wave: Sweden's Integration into the Imperialist World System" featuring Torkil Lauesen. We plan on periodically remastering some of our early episodes and re-releasing them as well, and releasing them one every month or two between our regular episodes. Stay tuned for that!</p> <p>Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory" target="_blank" rel= "noopener" data-saferedirecturl= "https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory&source=gmail&ust=1683964557249000&usg=AOvVaw30MsLjFab_1zdkL_I2ZKm2"> https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a></p> <p>Torkil Lauesen returns to the show, this time to discuss his newest book "Riding the Wave: Sweden's Integration into the Imperialist World Order". Pushing back against the narrative that Nordic countries like Sweden are socialist paradises who don't engage in colonialism and imperialism like other western countries, Torkil dives deep into history to deconstruct this rather naive perspective and offer a historical materialist account of Sweden's actual place in the history of colonialism, capitalism, and imperialism. </p> <p><a href="https://www.patreon.com/huck1995/posts">Henry Hakamaki</a> from <a href= "https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/">Guerrilla History</a> joins Breht for the interview as well! </p> <p>Check out the book here: <a href= "https://www.leftwingbooks.net/book/content/riding-wave-sweden">https://www.leftwingbooks.net/book/content/riding-wave-sweden</a></p> <p>Read more of Torkil's work here: <a href= "https://anti-imperialist.net/author/lauesen/">https://anti-imperialist.net/author/lauesen/</a></p> <p>Outro Music: <em>"I'm the Echo</em><em>"</em> by DARKSIDE</p> <p>-----</p> <p>Support Rev Left Radio: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/RevLeftRadio">https://www.patreon.com/RevLeftRadio</a></p> <p>or make a one time donation: PayPal.me/revleft</p> <p>LEARN MORE ABOUT REV LEFT RADIO: <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">www.revolutionaryleftradio.com</a></p>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>Decolonizing Science w/ Sibusiso Biyela</title>
      <itunes:title>Decolonizing Science w/ Sibusiso Biyela</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 19 May 2023 06:43:52 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[8ae1961d-433c-4340-9baf-2f729692d7ec]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/decolonizing-science-w-sibusiso-biyela]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<div dir="auto"> <div dir="auto"> <p class="p1">In this really great discussion, we talk with science communicator Sibusiso Biyela about decolonizing science, from both theoretical and practical standpoints!  This is a fascinating topic that we hope to explore further in upcoming episodes, and a topic that doesn't get nearly the attention or comradely discussion that it deserves.</p> </div> </div> <div dir="auto">Sibusiso Biyela is a science communicator and journalist in South Africa.  He also co-hosts the isiZulu language science podcast <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/ilukuluku/id1617276271">iLukuluku</a>.  You can find more of Sibusiso's work through his <a href= "https://linktr.ee/astrosibs">Linktree</a>, and follow him on twitter <a href="twitter.com/astrosibs">@astrosibs</a>.</div> <div dir="auto"> </div> <div dir="auto">Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory" target="_blank" rel= "noopener" data-saferedirecturl= "https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory&source=gmail&ust=1683964557249000&usg=AOvVaw30MsLjFab_1zdkL_I2ZKm2"> https://www.patreon.com/<wbr />guerrillahistory</a></div>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1">In this really great discussion, we talk with science communicator Sibusiso Biyela about decolonizing science, from both theoretical and practical standpoints! This is a fascinating topic that we hope to explore further in upcoming episodes, and a topic that doesn't get nearly the attention or comradely discussion that it deserves.</p> Sibusiso Biyela is a science communicator and journalist in South Africa. He also co-hosts the isiZulu language science podcast <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/ilukuluku/id1617276271">iLukuluku</a>. You can find more of Sibusiso's work through his <a href= "https://linktr.ee/astrosibs">Linktree</a>, and follow him on twitter <a href="twitter.com/astrosibs">@astrosibs</a>. Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory" target="_blank" rel= "noopener" data-saferedirecturl= "https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory&source=gmail&ust=1683964557249000&usg=AOvVaw30MsLjFab_1zdkL_I2ZKm2"> https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>A History of the World in 7 Cheap Things w/ Jason W. Moore &amp; Raj Patel</title>
      <itunes:title>A History of the World in 7 Cheap Things w/ Jason W. Moore &amp; Raj Patel</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 12 May 2023 14:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[8b27a02f-c65b-4ab9-b288-52bd110f12be]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/a-history-of-the-world-in-7-cheap-things-w-jason-w-moore-raj-patel]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<div dir="auto"> <div dir="auto"> <p class="p1">In this terrific episode, we talk with Professors Jason W. Moore and  Raj Patel about their fabulous work <a href= "https://www.ucpress.edu/book/9780520299931/a-history-of-the-world-in-seven-cheap-things"> A History of the World in 7 Cheap Things</a>, which analyzes the history of the world's planetary emergency through Cheap nature, money, work, care, food, energy, & lives.  A super important conversation with two vital thinkers, you're definitely going to want to read the book if you haven't already!</p> </div> </div> <div dir="auto">Jason W. Moore is an environmental historian and historical geographer at Binghamton University, and has authored multiple outstanding books.  You can follow Jason on twitter @oikeios</div> <div dir="auto"> </div> <div dir="auto">Raj Patel is an award-winning writer, activist, and academic. He is Research Professor in the Lyndon B. Johnson School of Public Affairs at the University of Texas, Austin and Senior Research Associate at the Unit for the Humanities at Rhodes University. He has numerous projects that you can keep up with by following him on Twitter @_RajPatel</div> <div dir="auto"> </div> <div dir="auto">Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory" target="_blank" rel= "noopener" data-saferedirecturl= "https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory&source=gmail&ust=1683964557249000&usg=AOvVaw30MsLjFab_1zdkL_I2ZKm2"> https://www.patreon.com/<wbr />guerrillahistory</a></div>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p class="p1">In this terrific episode, we talk with Professors Jason W. Moore and Raj Patel about their fabulous work <a href= "https://www.ucpress.edu/book/9780520299931/a-history-of-the-world-in-seven-cheap-things"> A History of the World in 7 Cheap Things</a>, which analyzes the history of the world's planetary emergency through Cheap nature, money, work, care, food, energy, & lives. A super important conversation with two vital thinkers, you're definitely going to want to read the book if you haven't already!</p> Jason W. Moore is an environmental historian and historical geographer at Binghamton University, and has authored multiple outstanding books. You can follow Jason on twitter @oikeios Raj Patel is an award-winning writer, activist, and academic. He is Research Professor in the Lyndon B. Johnson School of Public Affairs at the University of Texas, Austin and Senior Research Associate at the Unit for the Humanities at Rhodes University. He has numerous projects that you can keep up with by following him on Twitter @_RajPatel Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory" target="_blank" rel= "noopener" data-saferedirecturl= "https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory&source=gmail&ust=1683964557249000&usg=AOvVaw30MsLjFab_1zdkL_I2ZKm2"> https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>Dedollarization &amp; the Petrodollar w/ Richard Wolff</title>
      <itunes:title>Dedollarization &amp;amp; the Petrodollar w/ Richard Wolff</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 05 May 2023 17:15:58 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[5c185f0b-bc1d-4169-bc76-6d160cde7b55]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/dedollarization-the-petrodollar-w-richard-wolff]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this fun episode, we talk with Professor Richard Wolff about the process of dedollarization, its impact on the Petrodollar, and how these play into geopolitics more broadly including the ability of the US to sanction whomever they wish - processes that we need to continue keeping an eye on.  A really interesting conversation, we're looking forward to continuing it very soon!!</p> <p>Richard Wolff is a Professor Emeritus of Economics at UMass-Amherst and a Visiting Professor at The New School.  He is also the host of <a href= "https://economicupdate.libsyn.com/">Economic Update</a> and the founder of <a href="https://www.democracyatwork.info/">Democracy At Work</a>.  You can follow him on Twitter <a href= "twitter.com/profwolff">@profwolff</a>.</p> <p>Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this fun episode, we talk with Professor Richard Wolff about the process of dedollarization, its impact on the Petrodollar, and how these play into geopolitics more broadly including the ability of the US to sanction whomever they wish - processes that we need to continue keeping an eye on. A really interesting conversation, we're looking forward to continuing it very soon!!</p> <p>Richard Wolff is a Professor Emeritus of Economics at UMass-Amherst and a Visiting Professor at The New School. He is also the host of <a href= "https://economicupdate.libsyn.com/">Economic Update</a> and the founder of <a href="https://www.democracyatwork.info/">Democracy At Work</a>. You can follow him on Twitter <a href= "twitter.com/profwolff">@profwolff</a>.</p> <p>Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>Right Wing Moral Panic: "The Crisis of Masculinity" - Unlocked IB</title>
      <itunes:title>Right Wing Moral Panic: &quot;The Crisis of Masculinity&quot; - Unlocked IB</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 28 Apr 2023 09:37:09 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[0d175a69-fb78-4ea0-932a-5a8d7c17e7e6]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/right-wing-moral-panic-the-crisis-of-masculinity-unlocked-ib]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this patreon-early access Intelligence Briefing, Adnan and Breht discuss the current moral panic on the political right around issues of masculinity, dropping testosterone levels, and family formation. Together they discuss how the Right obscures the role of under-regulated corporations in poisoning us and the role capitalism plays in destabilizing human life in general, and instead blame scapegoats like life-saving vaccines, innocuous food stuffs like soy, feminism, LGBTQ people, and liberal elites (but never reactionary ones ofc). In addition, they try to think through what masculinity actually is, how it might express itself in healthy ways, what the left can offer young people in general, how reactionary notions of masculinity are rooted in profound fear and insecurity, and how misogynistic figures in the manosphere actually hamstring and poison the minds of young men trying to find a good partner and build a meaningful life.</p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content:</span> <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> </span></p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this patreon-early access Intelligence Briefing, Adnan and Breht discuss the current moral panic on the political right around issues of masculinity, dropping testosterone levels, and family formation. In addition, they try to think through what masculinity actually is, how it might express itself in healthy ways, what the left can offer young people in general, how reactionary notions of masculinity are rooted in profound fear and insecurity, and how misogynistic figures in the manosphere actually hamstring and poison the minds of young men trying to find a good partner and build a meaningful life.</p> <p> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>History and Impacts of the Blockade Yemen w/ Shireen Al-Adeimi</title>
      <itunes:title>History and Impacts of the Blockade Yemen w/ Shireen Al-Adeimi</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 21 Apr 2023 07:58:41 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[72905f8a-5465-4541-9284-d5875007196f]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/history-and-impacts-of-the-blockade-yemen-w-shireen-al-adeimi]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>This episode of Guerrilla History is a continuation of our Sanctions As War miniseries (get the book <a href= "https://www.haymarketbooks.org/books/2024-sanctions-as-war">here</a>).  In this critical episode, we bring on the wonderful Shireen Al-Adeimi to discuss the history and impact of the blockade on Yemen, and how this blockade is intimately tied to the geopolitics of the region.  Get the word out and share this with comrades involved in the anti-sanctions movement.</p> <div class="page" title="Page 12"> <div class="layoutArea"> <div class="column"> <div class="page" title="Page 14"> <div class="layoutArea"> <div class="column"> <p>Shireen Al-Adeimi is an assistant professor of language and literacy at Michigan State University, and is an expert on the war and humanitarian crisis in her country of birth, Yemen. She writes for <a href="https://inthesetimes.com/authors/shireen-al-adeimi">In These Times</a> and <a href= "https://responsiblestatecraft.org/author/shireenaladeimi/">Responsible Statecraft</a>, and speaks and writes frequently on Yemen for media globally.  You can follow her on twitter <a href= "twitter.com/shireen818">@shireen818</a>, and help support the <a href="https://yemenfoundation.org/">Yemen Relief & Reconstruction Foundation</a>.</p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content:</span> <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> </span></p> </div> </div> </div> </div> </div> </div>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This episode of Guerrilla History is a continuation of our Sanctions As War miniseries (get the book <a href= "https://www.haymarketbooks.org/books/2024-sanctions-as-war">here</a>). In this critical episode, we bring on the wonderful Shireen Al-Adeimi to discuss the history and impact of the blockade on Yemen, and how this blockade is intimately tied to the geopolitics of the region. Get the word out and share this with comrades involved in the anti-sanctions movement.</p> <p>Shireen Al-Adeimi is an assistant professor of language and literacy at Michigan State University, and is an expert on the war and humanitarian crisis in her country of birth, Yemen. She writes for <a href="https://inthesetimes.com/authors/shireen-al-adeimi">In These Times</a> and <a href= "https://responsiblestatecraft.org/author/shireenaladeimi/">Responsible Statecraft</a>, and speaks and writes frequently on Yemen for media globally. You can follow her on twitter <a href= "twitter.com/shireen818">@shireen818</a>, and help support the <a href="https://yemenfoundation.org/">Yemen Relief & Reconstruction Foundation</a>.</p> <p> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>Concerning Violence - Review, From the Archives</title>

    <item>
      <title>Laundering Black Rage - From the Archives</title>
      <itunes:title>Laundering Black Rage - From the Archives</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 31 Mar 2023 06:48:29 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[58597ce8-26c2-4aaa-a712-c68abb0fff6d]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/laundering-black-rage-from-the-archives]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>This From the Archives episode is a crossover between Guerrilla History and the Black Myths Podcast, originally released on our <a href="patreon.com/guerrillahistory">patreon</a> back in early November. Cohost Henry sits down with Too Black to talk about his fantastic essay <em>Laundering Black Rage</em> which is available in two parts (Part 1: <a href= "https://www.blackagendareport.com/laundering-black-rage," target= "_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.blackagendareport.com/laundering-black-rage,</a> Part 2: <a href= "https://www.blackagendareport.com/laundering-black-rage-part-2)" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.blackagendareport.com/laundering-black-rage-part-2)</a> from the fabulous Black Agenda Report.  This really great conversation touches on a lot of tangential topics to the essay as well, so be sure to both read the essay AND listen to the episode!</p> <p>Too Black is a poet, host of the <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/podcast/id1504205689?ls=1" target= "_blank" rel="nofollow noopener">Black Myths Podcast</a> , member of <a href="https://blackallianceforpeace.com/#home-above-fold" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener">Black Alliance For Peace</a> , and communications coordinator for the Defense Committee to Free the <a href="https://linktr.ee/freedomcampaign" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener">Pendleton 2</a> .  You can find him on twitter <a href= "twitter.com/too_black_">@too_black_</a></p> <p>Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a></p> <p> </p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This From the Archives episode is a crossover between Guerrilla History and the Black Myths Podcast, originally released on our <a href="patreon.com/guerrillahistory">patreon</a> back in early November. Cohost Henry sits down with Too Black to talk about his fantastic essay <em>Laundering Black Rage</em> which is available in two parts (Part 1: <a href= "https://www.blackagendareport.com/laundering-black-rage," target= "_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.blackagendareport.com/laundering-black-rage,</a> Part 2: <a href= "https://www.blackagendareport.com/laundering-black-rage-part-2)" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.blackagendareport.com/laundering-black-rage-part-2)</a> from the fabulous Black Agenda Report. This really great conversation touches on a lot of tangential topics to the essay as well, so be sure to both read the essay AND listen to the episode!</p> <p>Too Black is a poet, host of the <a href= "https://podcasts.apple.com/podcast/id1504205689?ls=1" target= "_blank" rel="nofollow noopener">Black Myths Podcast</a> , member of <a href="https://blackallianceforpeace.com/#home-above-fold" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener">Black Alliance For Peace</a> , and communications coordinator for the Defense Committee to Free the <a href="https://linktr.ee/freedomcampaign" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener">Pendleton 2</a> . You can find him on twitter <a href= "twitter.com/too_black_">@too_black_</a></p> <p>Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a></p> <p> </p>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>The History and Impact of Sanctions on Syria w/ Greg Shupak</title>

      <pubDate>Fri, 10 Mar 2023 09:48:25 +0000</pubDate>

      <description><![CDATA[<p>This episode of Guerrilla History is a continuation of our Sanctions As War miniseries.  In this important episode, we bring on Greg Shupak to discuss the history and impact of sanctions on Syria, and how these sanctions continue in their brutality despite the ongoing humanitarian disaster unfolding.  Get the word out and share this with comrades involved in the anti-sanctions movement.</p> <div class="page" title="Page 12"> <div class="layoutArea"> <div class="column"> <div class="page" title="Page 14"> <div class="layoutArea"> <div class="column"> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Greg Shupak teaches English and Media Studies at the University of Guelph-Humber and is the author of the book,<em> <a href= "https://www.orbooks.com/catalog/wrong-story-greg-shupak/">The Wrong Story: Palestine, Israel, and the Media</a></em> (OR Books, 2018).  You can follow him on twitter <a href= "twitter.com/GregShupak">@GregShupak</a>.</span></p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content:</span> <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a><span style="font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> </span></p> </div> </div> </div> </div> </div> </div>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This episode of Guerrilla History is a continuation of our Sanctions As War miniseries. In this important episode, we bring on Greg Shupak to discuss the history and impact of sanctions on Syria, and how these sanctions continue in their brutality despite the ongoing humanitarian disaster unfolding. Get the word out and share this with comrades involved in the anti-sanctions movement.</p> <p> Greg Shupak teaches English and Media Studies at the University of Guelph-Humber and is the author of the book,<em> <a href= "https://www.orbooks.com/catalog/wrong-story-greg-shupak/">The Wrong Story: Palestine, Israel, and the Media</a></em> (OR Books, 2018). You can follow him on twitter <a href= "twitter.com/GregShupak">@GregShupak</a>.</p> <p> Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>Wounded Knee '73 at 50 Retrospective w/ Sungmanitou Tanka</title>
      <itunes:title>Wounded Knee &#39;73 at 50 Retrospective w/ Sungmanitou Tanka</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 03 Mar 2023 11:07:50 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[dd9e45be-c05c-4253-abdb-8f1b6ecb1629]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/wounded-knee-73-at-50-retrospective-w-sungmanitou-tanka]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<div class="CNxNUMI4vuO8-fkO8bPPMQ== FdGBl7+r1sQJZTUFqRjvJw==" data-block="true" data-editor="6g5p4" data-offset-key="296p8-0-0"> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="296p8-0-0"><span data-offset-key= "296p8-0-0"><span data-text="true">In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on discussion on all of these fronts.</span></span></div> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="296p8-0-0"> </div> </div> <div class="CNxNUMI4vuO8-fkO8bPPMQ== FdGBl7+r1sQJZTUFqRjvJw==" data-block="true" data-editor="6g5p4" data-offset-key="6vi2b-0-0"> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr"
