    <item>
      <title>Coups, Oil, the CIA, and Arab Nationalism in Iraq w/ Brandon Wolfe-Hunnicutt</title>
      <itunes:title>Coups, Oil, the CIA, and Arab Nationalism in Iraq w/ Brandon Wolfe-Hunnicutt</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 08 Jul 2022 08:00:04 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[f7923e0a-3d4c-4e47-b599-3c93f893a2bf]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/coups-oil-the-cia-and-arab-nationalism-in-iraq-w-brandon-wolfe-hunnicutt]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this fascinating episode, we talk with Professor Brandon Wolfe-Hunnicutt about the numerous coups of Iraq from 1953-1968 (and the CIA/State Department role in these) amidst the background of rising Arab nationalist politics and pushes by several groups for nationalization of Iraqi oil.  A fantastic discussion based off of Brandon's equally fabulous book <em>The Paranoid Style in American Diplomacy: Oil and Arab Nationalism in Iraq</em>!</p> <p>Brandon Wolfe-Hunnicutt is a historian at California State University, Stanislas.  You can (and should!) get <em>The Paranoid Style in American Diplomacy: Oil and Arab Nationalism in Iraq</em> from Stanford University Press <a href= "https://www.sup.org/books/title/?id=26330">https://www.sup.org/books/title/?id=26330</a> </p> <p>Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this fascinating episode, we talk with Professor Brandon Wolfe-Hunnicutt about the numerous coups of Iraq from 1953-1968 (and the CIA/State Department role in these) amidst the background of rising Arab nationalist politics and pushes by several groups for nationalization of Iraqi oil. A fantastic discussion based off of Brandon's equally fabulous book <em>The Paranoid Style in American Diplomacy: Oil and Arab Nationalism in Iraq</em>!</p> <p>Brandon Wolfe-Hunnicutt is a historian at California State University, Stanislas. You can (and should!) get <em>The Paranoid Style in American Diplomacy: Oil and Arab Nationalism in Iraq</em> from Stanford University Press <a href= "https://www.sup.org/books/title/?id=26330">https://www.sup.org/books/title/?id=26330</a> </p> <p>Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></content:encoded>

      <itunes:title>Shut Down Red Hill!  Naval Pollution Disaster w/ Mikey from O&#39;ahu Water Protectors: Dispatch</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 01 Jul 2022 07:25:30 +0000</pubDate>

      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this Dispatch, we talk to Mikey from O'ahu Water Protectors about the both ongoing and impending disaster at the Red Hill facility, where the US Navy's fuel continues to leak into the largest aquifer on the island of O'ahu.  We discuss the history of this fuel facility, and the activism taking place to shut it down!</p> <p>You can find Mikey on various social media platforms, including Twitter, @karaokecomputer.  You can find more information about O'ahu Water Protectors and the efforts to shut down Red Hill at <a href= "oahuwaterprotectors.org">oahuwaterprotectors.org</a>.</p> <p>Help support the show by signing up to our patreon, where you also will get bonus content: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a> </p>]]></description>

    <item>
      <title>Time with the Red Army Faction w/ Margrit Schiller</title>
      <itunes:title>Time with the Red Army Faction w/ Margrit Schiller</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 17 Jun 2022 08:24:36 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[7202151a-b941-4bf4-8c5e-8f3a70a1d086]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/time-with-the-red-army-faction-w-margrit-schiller]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on a very special guest, Margrit Schiller!  Margrit was associated early on with the Red Army Faction, before being imprisoned and tortured by the West German state, being forced into exile in Cuba and Uruguay, and then having to move back to Germany more or less against her will.  A fascinating life story from someone just as committed to the struggle as ever!</p> <p>Margrit Schiller is author of <em>Remembering the Armed Struggle: My Time with the Red Army Faction.</em>  We highly recommend picking yourself up a copy from PM Press (<a href= "https://pmpress.org/index.php?l=product_detail&p=1195">https://pmpress.org/index.php?l=product_detail&p=1195</a>).  Margrit's struggles within and against this system continue, and grabbing a copy of her book is a good way to help while we are still forced to operate within capitalism.</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a new Youtube show/podcast he cohosts with our friend Safie called What The Huck?!, which can be found on youtube at <a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA7YUQWncZIB2nIeEunE31Q/">https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA7YUQWncZIB2nIeEunE31Q/</a> or major podcast apps at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/what-the-huck">https://anchor.fm/what-the-huck</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on a very special guest, Margrit Schiller! Margrit was associated early on with the Red Army Faction, before being imprisoned and tortured by the West German state, being forced into exile in Cuba and Uruguay, and then having to move back to Germany more or less against her will. A fascinating life story from someone just as committed to the struggle as ever!</p> <p>Margrit Schiller is author of <em>Remembering the Armed Struggle: My Time with the Red Army Faction.</em> We highly recommend picking yourself up a copy from PM Press (<a href= "https://pmpress.org/index.php?l=product_detail&p=1195">https://pmpress.org/index.php?l=product_detail&p=1195</a>). Margrit's struggles within and against this system continue, and grabbing a copy of her book is a good way to help while we are still forced to operate within capitalism.</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a new Youtube show/podcast he cohosts with our friend Safie called What The Huck?!, which can be found on youtube at <a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA7YUQWncZIB2nIeEunE31Q/">https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA7YUQWncZIB2nIeEunE31Q/</a> or major podcast apps at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/what-the-huck">https://anchor.fm/what-the-huck</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>. Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod. Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>. </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>From the Archives - Historical Impact of the Plague</title>
      <itunes:title>From the Archives - Historical Impact of the Plague</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 10 Jun 2022 07:11:13 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[68eb4fd4-10bb-4bc2-bc72-1be5c37c2a3b]]></guid>

      <description><![CDATA[<div class="sc-1sp3zau-0 dmNpZN sc-1di2uql-0 gLnsGk" data-tag= "post-content"> <p>Guerrilla History "From the Archives" is a new series of episodes, consisting of previously patreon-exclusive episodes that we are unlocking for the general public after one year.  This From the Archives episode was originally released on Patreon on November 4, 2020, and is about the plague.  Join us in this old episode where we discussed a bit of the science of the plague, as well as the historical impact of it in the 14th century.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a new Youtube show/podcast he cohosts with our friend Safie called What The Huck?!, which can be found on youtube at <a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA7YUQWncZIB2nIeEunE31Q/">https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA7YUQWncZIB2nIeEunE31Q/</a> or major podcast apps at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/what-the-huck">https://anchor.fm/what-the-huck</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>. </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> </div>]]></description>

      <title>Indian Farmers' Protest Retrospective w/ Sandeep Rauzi and Santosh Kumar: Dispatch</title>
      <itunes:title>Indian Farmers&#39; Protest Retrospective w/ Sandeep Rauzi and Santosh Kumar: Dispatch</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 27 May 2022 09:59:40 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[fdf76604-7681-48ed-a637-1305923c303c]]></guid>

      <description><![CDATA[<div class="DraftEditor-paragraphElement" data-block="true" data-editor="7782v" data-offset-key="9mumi-0-0"> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="9mumi-0-0"><span data-offset-key="9mumi-0-0">In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Santosh Kumar and Sandeep Rauzi of <a href="workersunity.com">workersunity.com</a> to give a retrospective look at the massive Indian Farmers' Protests that went on for over a year, from the perspective of journalist activists on the ground! We discuss the conditions of Indian agricultural workers before the protests, the "Farm Bills" that sparked the protests, what the protests were like, and what has happened since the Indian government has dropped the proposed bills! </span></div> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="9mumi-0-0"> </div> </div> <div class="DraftEditor-paragraphElement" data-block="true" data-editor="7782v" data-offset-key="3gd9i-0-0"> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="3gd9i-0-0">Sandeep Rauzi and Santosh Kumar are activists and citizen journalists that helped co-found Workers' Unity - an independent media platform dedicated to the struggles of the toiling masses, which focused heavily on the Farmers' Protests.  In addition to their website <a href= "https://www.workersunity.com/">workersunity.com</a>, you can also find them on YouTube <a href= "https://www.youtube.com/c/workersunity">https://www.youtube.com/c/workersunity</a>, and Facebook <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/WorkersUnity18">https://www.facebook.com/WorkersUnity18</a>.  Help spread the word about their media collective!</div> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="3gd9i-0-0"> </div> </div> <div class="DraftEditor-paragraphElement" data-block="true" data-editor="7782v" data-offset-key="cqq-0-0"> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="cqq-0-0"><span data-offset-key="cqq-0-0">Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.       <content:encoded><![CDATA[In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Santosh Kumar and Sandeep Rauzi of <a href="workersunity.com">workersunity.com</a> to give a retrospective look at the massive Indian Farmers' Protests that went on for over a year, from the perspective of journalist activists on the ground! We discuss the conditions of Indian agricultural workers before the protests, the "Farm Bills" that sparked the protests, what the protests were like, and what has happened since the Indian government has dropped the proposed bills! Sandeep Rauzi and Santosh Kumar are activists and citizen journalists that helped co-found Workers' Unity - an independent media platform dedicated to the struggles of the toiling masses, which focused heavily on the Farmers' Protests. In addition to their website <a href= "https://www.workersunity.com/">workersunity.com</a>, you can also find them on YouTube <a href= "https://www.youtube.com/c/workersunity">https://www.youtube.com/c/workersunity</a>, and Facebook <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/WorkersUnity18">https://www.facebook.com/WorkersUnity18</a>. Help spread the word about their media collective! Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at <a href= "mailto:guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com">guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com</a>. Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea. Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a class="sc-1bctqj2-0 qOIqX" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed! To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a new Youtube show/podcast he cohosts with our friend Safie called What The Huck?!, which can be found on youtube at <a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA7YUQWncZIB2nIeEunE31Q/">https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA7YUQWncZIB2nIeEunE31Q/</a> or major podcast apps at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/what-the-huck">https://anchor.fm/what-the-huck</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>. Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod. Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>. Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>Ownership of Development, China in Africa, and AFRICOM (Part 2) w/ Takiyah Harper-Shipman</title>
      <itunes:title>Ownership of Development, China in Africa, and AFRICOM (Part 2) w/ Takiyah Harper-Shipman</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 20 May 2022 09:05:40 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[0c24dbce-30bb-4326-b7c4-32417e182028]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/ownership-of-development-china-in-africa-and-africom-part-2-w-takiyah-harper-shipman]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring back Africana studies scholar, Professor Takiyah Harper-Shipman, to continue our conversation!  This time, the discussion focused on the paradigm of ownership of development, China's role in Africa, and AFRICOM!  If you haven't already listened to part 1 of the conversation, you should do so first, it will be a good primer for this episode.  Part 3, on African feminisms, is forthcoming!</p> <p>Takiyah Harper-Shipman is an Assistant Professor in the Africana Studies Department at Davidson College.  Her courses include Africana political economy, gender and development in sub-Saharan Africa, African feminisms, international development: theory and praxis, and research methods in Africana Studies.  Her book <em>Rethinking Ownership of Development in Africa</em> is available from Routledge: <a href= "https://www.routledge.com/Rethinking-Ownership-of-Development-in-Africa/Harper-Shipman/p/book/9780367787813"> https://www.routledge.com/Rethinking-Ownership-of-Development-in-Africa/Harper-Shipman/p/book/9780367787813</a>.  We also highly recommend checking out her chapter La Santé Avant Tout: Health Before Everything in the excellent <em>A Certain Amount of Madness</em><br /> <em>The Life, Politics and Legacies of Thomas Sankara</em> <a href= "https://www.research.lancs.ac.uk/portal/en/people/ruth-wodak(71b5650a-f48c-4c2e-8b71-6896e291dc2b).html"> https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745337579/a-certain-amount-of-madness/</a>.  </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a new Youtube show/podcast he cohosts with our friend Safie called What The Huck?!, which can be found on youtube at <a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA7YUQWncZIB2nIeEunE31Q/">https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA7YUQWncZIB2nIeEunE31Q/</a> or major podcast apps at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/what-the-huck">https://anchor.fm/what-the-huck</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring back Africana studies scholar, Professor Takiyah Harper-Shipman, to continue our conversation! This time, the discussion focused on the paradigm of ownership of development, China's role in Africa, and AFRICOM! If you haven't already listened to part 1 of the conversation, you should do so first, it will be a good primer for this episode. Part 3, on African feminisms, is forthcoming!</p> <p>Takiyah Harper-Shipman is an Assistant Professor in the Africana Studies Department at Davidson College. Her courses include Africana political economy, gender and development in sub-Saharan Africa, African feminisms, international development: theory and praxis, and research methods in Africana Studies. Her book <em>Rethinking Ownership of Development in Africa</em> is available from Routledge: <a href= "https://www.routledge.com/Rethinking-Ownership-of-Development-in-Africa/Harper-Shipman/p/book/9780367787813"> https://www.routledge.com/Rethinking-Ownership-of-Development-in-Africa/Harper-Shipman/p/book/9780367787813</a>. We also highly recommend checking out her chapter La Santé Avant Tout: Health Before Everything in the excellent <em>A Certain Amount of Madness</em> <em>The Life, Politics and Legacies of Thomas Sankara</em> <a href= "https://www.research.lancs.ac.uk/portal/en/people/ruth-wodak(71b5650a-f48c-4c2e-8b71-6896e291dc2b).html"> https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745337579/a-certain-amount-of-madness/</a>. </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a new Youtube show/podcast he cohosts with our friend Safie called What The Huck?!, which can be found on youtube at <a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA7YUQWncZIB2nIeEunE31Q/">https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCA7YUQWncZIB2nIeEunE31Q/</a> or major podcast apps at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/what-the-huck">https://anchor.fm/what-the-huck</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>. Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod. Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>. </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>From the Archives - The Bandung Conference</title>
      <itunes:title>From the Archives - The Bandung Conference</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2022 17:08:29 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[f59cdf15-4aca-4623-b270-10ff87eb13ec]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/from-the-archives-the-bandung-conference]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<div class="sc-1sp3zau-0 dmNpZN sc-1di2uql-0 gLnsGk" data-tag= "post-content"> <p>Guerrilla History "From the Archives" is a new series of episodes, consisting of previously patreon-exclusive episodes that we are unlocking for the general public after one year.  This inaugural From the Archives episode was originally released on Patreon on December 25, 2020, and is about the famous Bandung Conference of 1955.  Join us as we describe the historical context of the Bandung Conference, and it's enduring importance.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> </div>]]></description>

      <title>Reproductive Rights Under Attack: SCOTUS &amp; Roe v. Wade</title>
      <itunes:title>Reproductive Rights Under Attack: SCOTUS &amp;amp; Roe v. Wade</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Tue, 03 May 2022 18:36:58 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[f1b640dd-976f-4b24-b65d-5e187bd8e098]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/women-under-attack-scotus-roe-v-wade]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<div class="DraftEditor-paragraphElement" data-block="true" data-editor="7782v" data-offset-key="9mumi-0-0"> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="9mumi-0-0"><span data-offset-key="9mumi-0-0">In this Dispatch episode of Guerrilla History (and crossover with Revolutionary Left Radio), we discuss the newly leaked draft opinion from the Supreme Court of the United States what would overturn Roe v. Wade and strip the right of access to safe abortion to millions of Americans. We try to frame this historically, and discuss the politics of this draft, which is set to be finalized and voted on in just over a month. A critical topic for us all to focus on right now, and to think together about what steps to take next.  The full text of the draft opinion can be found here: <a href= "https://www.politico.com/news/2022/05/02/read-justice-alito-initial-abortion-opinion-overturn-roe-v-wade-pdf-00029504"> https://www.politico.com/news/2022/05/02/read-justice-alito-initial-abortion-opinion-overturn-roe-v-wade-pdf-00029504</a> </span></div> </div> <div class="DraftEditor-paragraphElement" data-block="true" data-editor="7782v" data-offset-key="3gd9i-0-0"> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="3gd9i-0-0"> </div> </div> <div class="DraftEditor-paragraphElement" data-block="true" data-editor="7782v" data-offset-key="cqq-0-0"> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="cqq-0-0"><span data-offset-key="cqq-0-0">Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.       <content:encoded><![CDATA[In this Dispatch episode of Guerrilla History (and crossover with Revolutionary Left Radio), we discuss the newly leaked draft opinion from the Supreme Court of the United States what would overturn Roe v. Wade and strip the right of access to safe abortion to millions of Americans. We try to frame this historically, and discuss the politics of this draft, which is set to be finalized and voted on in just over a month. A critical topic for us all to focus on right now, and to think together about what steps to take next. The full text of the draft opinion can be found here: <a href= "https://www.politico.com/news/2022/05/02/read-justice-alito-initial-abortion-opinion-overturn-roe-v-wade-pdf-00029504"> https://www.politico.com/news/2022/05/02/read-justice-alito-initial-abortion-opinion-overturn-roe-v-wade-pdf-00029504</a> Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at <a href= "mailto:guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com">guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com</a>. Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea. Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a class="sc-1bctqj2-0 qOIqX" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.     <item>
      <title>W. African Women's Development (Part 1) w/ Takiyah Harper-Shipman</title>
      <itunes:title>W. African Women&#39;s Development (Part 1) w/ Takiyah Harper-Shipman</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 29 Apr 2022 19:49:06 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[7489e7aa-0552-40ab-9649-e275088bc445]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/takiyah]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on the fantastic Africana studies scholar, Professor Takiyah Harper-Shipman, to talk about West African women's development, Sankara, AFRICOM, and more!  Due to time constraints, this episode will act as an introduction to these topics for our next conversation with Professor Harper-Shipman, which will take place soon and will be a longer, more in-depth discussion.  We really enjoyed the conversation, and are already looking forward to diving into the minutiae with the Professor very soon!</p> <p>Takiyah Harper-Shipman is an Assistant Professor in the Africana Studies Department at Davidson College.  Her courses include Africana political economy, gender and development in sub-Saharan Africa, African feminisms, international development: theory and praxis, and research methods in Africana Studies.  Her book <em>Rethinking Ownership of Development in Africa</em> is available from Routledge: <a href= "https://www.routledge.com/Rethinking-Ownership-of-Development-in-Africa/Harper-Shipman/p/book/9780367787813"> https://www.routledge.com/Rethinking-Ownership-of-Development-in-Africa/Harper-Shipman/p/book/9780367787813</a>.  We also highly recommend checking out her chapter La Santé Avant Tout: Health Before Everything in the excellent <em>A Certain Amount of Madness</em><br /> <em>The Life, Politics and Legacies of Thomas Sankara</em> <a href= "https://www.research.lancs.ac.uk/portal/en/people/ruth-wodak(71b5650a-f48c-4c2e-8b71-6896e291dc2b).html"> https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745337579/a-certain-amount-of-madness/</a>.  </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on the fantastic Africana studies scholar, Professor Takiyah Harper-Shipman, to talk about West African women's development, Sankara, AFRICOM, and more! Due to time constraints, this episode will act as an introduction to these topics for our next conversation with Professor Harper-Shipman, which will take place soon and will be a longer, more in-depth discussion. We really enjoyed the conversation, and are already looking forward to diving into the minutiae with the Professor very soon!</p> <p>Takiyah Harper-Shipman is an Assistant Professor in the Africana Studies Department at Davidson College. Her courses include Africana political economy, gender and development in sub-Saharan Africa, African feminisms, international development: theory and praxis, and research methods in Africana Studies. Her book <em>Rethinking Ownership of Development in Africa</em> is available from Routledge: <a href= "https://www.routledge.com/Rethinking-Ownership-of-Development-in-Africa/Harper-Shipman/p/book/9780367787813"> https://www.routledge.com/Rethinking-Ownership-of-Development-in-Africa/Harper-Shipman/p/book/9780367787813</a>. We also highly recommend checking out her chapter La Santé Avant Tout: Health Before Everything in the excellent <em>A Certain Amount of Madness</em> <em>The Life, Politics and Legacies of Thomas Sankara</em> <a href= "https://www.research.lancs.ac.uk/portal/en/people/ruth-wodak(71b5650a-f48c-4c2e-8b71-6896e291dc2b).html"> https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745337579/a-certain-amount-of-madness/</a>. </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.       <itunes:duration>01:25:38</itunes:duration>

      <title>Rev Left Radio 5 Year Retrospective</title>
      <itunes:title>Rev Left Radio 5 Year Retrospective</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 15 Apr 2022 16:55:33 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[3ac8f899-5f6a-425c-9e09-ffd7dcd1a4b6]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/rev-left-radio-5-year-retrospective]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>This bonus episode turns the focus onto Breht as we celebrate and take a look back for the 5 year anniversary of the Revolutionary Left Radio family of shows.  Why is a history podcast putting out an episode like this?  Tune in and find out, we think you will enjoy the conversation! </p> <p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>

    <item>
      <title>Ibn Khaldun - "The Father of Sociology"</title>
      <itunes:title>Ibn Khaldun - &quot;The Father of Sociology&quot;</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 08 Apr 2022 18:19:40 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[1e74216c-f8fa-4a48-9b8b-c09d5b481937]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/ibn-khaldun-the-father-of-sociology]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this impromptu episode, Adnan teaches Henry and the audience about the great 14th-15th Century scholar Ibn Khaldun, who is sometimes called  the "father of sociology".  Ibn Khaldun also revolutionized the methodology of historical analysis in his time, and provides an excellent subject for us to discuss!</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>

      <title>Upcoming French Elections w/ Marlon Ettinger: Dispatch</title>
      <itunes:title>Upcoming French Elections w/ Marlon Ettinger: Dispatch</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 25 Mar 2022 07:07:36 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[26a09860-1998-48c1-a373-10f4d1916486]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/upcoming-french-elections-w-marlon-ettinger-dispatch]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<div class="DraftEditor-paragraphElement" data-block="true" data-editor="7782v" data-offset-key="9mumi-0-0"> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="9mumi-0-0"><span data-offset-key="9mumi-0-0">In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Marlon Ettinger to talk about the imminent French elections! We discuss the candidates, the prospects, and how French history plays into what we are currently seeing in France. An episode that will catch you up to speed on almost everything you need to know in advance of the elections! The first round takes place on April 10, the runoff second round is on April 24.</span></div> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="9mumi-0-0"> </div> </div> <div class="DraftEditor-paragraphElement" data-block="true" data-editor="7782v" data-offset-key="3gd9i-0-0"> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="3gd9i-0-0"><span data-offset-key= "3gd9i-0-0">Marlon Ettinger is an independent journalist currently covering the French elections from within France. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at</span> <a class= "sc-1bctqj2-0 qOIqX" href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis"><span data-offset-key= "76f76-3-0">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</span></a> <span data-offset-key="76f76-4-0">and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University,</span> <a class= "sc-1bctqj2-0 qOIqX" href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/"><span data-offset-key= "76f76-5-0">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</span></a><span data-offset-key="76f76-6-0">.       <content:encoded><![CDATA[In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Marlon Ettinger to talk about the imminent French elections! We discuss the candidates, the prospects, and how French history plays into what we are currently seeing in France. An episode that will catch you up to speed on almost everything you need to know in advance of the elections! The first round takes place on April 10, the runoff second round is on April 24. Marlon Ettinger is an independent journalist currently covering the French elections from within France. He is also the author of the soon-to-be-released book Zemmour and Gaullism, which will come out from Ebb Books. You can follow Marlon on twitter @MarlonEttinger, and can read his work and support him at <a href= "https://footnotesnews.substack.com/">https://footnotesnews.substack.com/</a> and <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/marlonjettinger">https://www.patreon.com/marlonjettinger</a>. Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at <a href= "mailto:guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com">guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com</a>. Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea. Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a class="sc-1bctqj2-0 qOIqX" href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed! To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a class="sc-1bctqj2-0 qOIqX" href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a class= "sc-1bctqj2-0 qOIqX" href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a class= "sc-1bctqj2-0 qOIqX" href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>. Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod. Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a class="sc-1bctqj2-0 qOIqX" href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>. Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>World Systems w/ Ariel Salzmann</title>
      <itunes:title>World Systems w/ Ariel Salzmann</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 11 Mar 2022 17:28:43 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[9faf87e4-1463-4dba-bc11-38c5a547efbf]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/world-systems-w-ariel-salzmann]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>A fascinating intelligence briefing on world systems theory, some of its thinkers and, some of the debates within the field!  This episode will hopefully help us in considering HOW we think about history, and how we analyze the driving force of events in the world.  We're joined by the esteemed Professor Ariel Salzmann, historian of Islamic and world history.</p> <p>Ariel Salzmann is a professor of Islamic and world history at Queen's University, and her research addresses theories of state formation, histories of Mediterranean communities and Muslim societies, the transformation of market systems and the making of global capitalism.  Her new book, <em>The Exclusionary West: Medieval Minorities and the Making of Modern Europe,</em>will be out in September: <a href= "https://www.hurstpublishers.com/book/the-exclusionary-west/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.hurstpublishers.com/book/the-exclusionary-west/</a> </p> <p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>A fascinating intelligence briefing on world systems theory, some of its thinkers and, some of the debates within the field! This episode will hopefully help us in considering HOW we think about history, and how we analyze the driving force of events in the world. We're joined by the esteemed Professor Ariel Salzmann, historian of Islamic and world history.</p> <p>Ariel Salzmann is a professor of Islamic and world history at Queen's University, and her research addresses theories of state formation, histories of Mediterranean communities and Muslim societies, the transformation of market systems and the making of global capitalism. Her new book, <em>The Exclusionary West: Medieval Minorities and the Making of Modern Europe,</em>will be out in September: <a href= "https://www.hurstpublishers.com/book/the-exclusionary-west/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.hurstpublishers.com/book/the-exclusionary-west/</a> </p> <p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice. Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod. Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed! Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a> Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a> Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod. You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></content:encoded>
      
      
      <enclosure url="https://traffic.libsyn.com/secure/guerrillahistory/Salzmann.mp3?dest-id=2463146" length="45397408" type="audio/mpeg" />
      <itunes:duration>01:34:04</itunes:duration>
      <itunes:explicit>false</itunes:explicit>

    <item>
      <title>History of Russia/Ukraine Relations w/ Alexey Sakhnin: Dispatch</title>
      <itunes:title>History of Russia/Ukraine Relations w/ Alexey Sakhnin: Dispatch</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 25 Feb 2022 20:54:10 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[c6d45699-9398-44b7-8941-0c3e6a407d42]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/history-of-russiaukraine-relations-w-alexey-sakhnin-dispatch]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Alexey Sakhnin to discuss the history of Russia/Ukraine relations.  Given the current events, this is an important topic for us to understand the historical context of.  Take the information here and use it to help you analyze what is unfolding!</p> <p>Alexey Sakhnin is a Russian activist, historian, Progressive International Council member, and member of the Left Front.  He has articles published all over the place, and more coming out all the time.  He will hopefully have a new article coming out via Jacobin soon, which will be available on his author page on their website: <a href= "https://jacobinmag.com/author/alexey-sakhnin">https://jacobinmag.com/author/alexey-sakhnin</a>.</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Alexey Sakhnin to discuss the history of Russia/Ukraine relations. Given the current events, this is an important topic for us to understand the historical context of. Take the information here and use it to help you analyze what is unfolding!</p> <p>Alexey Sakhnin is a Russian activist, historian, Progressive International Council member, and member of the Left Front.     <item>
      <title>Far-Right Rhetoric and the Politics of Fear w/ Ruth Wodak</title>
      <itunes:title>Far-Right Rhetoric and the Politics of Fear w/ Ruth Wodak</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 18 Feb 2022 00:23:57 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[bc599f0d-d97d-46d0-8101-8696e03f6dc2]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/wodak]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on the world-renowned linguist, Professor Ruth Wodak, to talk about her book <em>The Politics of Fear: The Shameless Normalization of Far-Right Discourse</em> (SAGE Publications).  This book takes both a historical and analytical look at how the rhetoric of the far-right ("right wing populist" in Prof Wodak's words) plays to and stokes our fears, and how far-right parties today are emulating the worst tendencies of far-right parties of the past.  A fascinating conversation on the intersections of linguistics and politics!  We are also joined by guest host Safine Ashirova, a Russian linguist who has also done linguistic research on the rhetoric of the Nazi Party as well as current far-right parties in Germany.</p> <p>Ruth Wodak is Emeritus Distinguished Professor at Lancaster University.  She is one of the pioneers of the Discourse Historical Approach of critical discourse analysis.  Her book <em>The Politics of Fear</em> is available from SAGE Publications: <a href= "https://us.sagepub.com/en-us/nam/the-politics-of-fear/book265617">https://us.sagepub.com/en-us/nam/the-politics-of-fear/book265617</a>.  You can also keep up with her latest academic publications using her research portal <a href= "https://www.research.lancs.ac.uk/portal/en/people/ruth-wodak(71b5650a-f48c-4c2e-8b71-6896e291dc2b).html"> https://www.research.lancs.ac.uk/portal/en/people/ruth-wodak(71b5650a-f48c-4c2e-8b71-6896e291dc2b).html</a>.  </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on the world-renowned linguist, Professor Ruth Wodak, to talk about her book <em>The Politics of Fear: The Shameless Normalization of Far-Right Discourse</em> (SAGE Publications). This book takes both a historical and analytical look at how the rhetoric of the far-right ("right wing populist" in Prof Wodak's words) plays to and stokes our fears, and how far-right parties today are emulating the worst tendencies of far-right parties of the past. A fascinating conversation on the intersections of linguistics and politics! We are also joined by guest host Safine Ashirova, a Russian linguist who has also done linguistic research on the rhetoric of the Nazi Party as well as current far-right parties in Germany.</p> <p>Ruth Wodak is Emeritus Distinguished Professor at Lancaster University. She is one of the pioneers of the Discourse Historical Approach of critical discourse analysis. Her book <em>The Politics of Fear</em> is available from SAGE Publications: <a href= "https://us.sagepub.com/en-us/nam/the-politics-of-fear/book265617">https://us.sagepub.com/en-us/nam/the-politics-of-fear/book265617</a>. You can also keep up with her latest academic publications using her research portal <a href= "https://www.research.lancs.ac.uk/portal/en/people/ruth-wodak(71b5650a-f48c-4c2e-8b71-6896e291dc2b).html"> https://www.research.lancs.ac.uk/portal/en/people/ruth-wodak(71b5650a-f48c-4c2e-8b71-6896e291dc2b).html</a>. </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>. Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod. Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>. </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>Representations of the Intellectual: Part 1</title>
      <itunes:title>Representations of the Intellectual: Part 1</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 04 Feb 2022 12:01:37 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[9d64abe5-6577-4b7f-99a8-8f20a6ab6306]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/representations-of-the-intellectual-part-1]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this Intelligence Briefing, the guys go over Edward Said's book Representations of the Intellectual, which was based on his 1993 series of Reith Lectures.  This book focuses on the conceptions of intellectuals and the roles that they should play within society.  A very fun conversation, on a very important work!  Part 2 of this conversation will be coming out as a Patreon Exclusive episode very soon. You can listen to Said's series of Reith Lectures for free here: <a href= "https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p00gxr1s" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p00gxr1s</a> </p> <p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>

      <title>Dissecting the American Empire in 2022 &amp; Beyond w/ Danny Haiphong</title>
      <itunes:title>Dissecting the American Empire in 2022 &amp;amp; Beyond w/ Danny Haiphong</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 29 Jan 2022 22:03:37 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[8c5d9590-11bf-405f-a87e-3b2d80d7599b]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/danny-haiphong]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this special crossover episode of Guerrilla History, we collaborate with friend of the show Danny Haiphong and his show The Internationalist Transmission to discuss US imperialism, the Russia-US tensions, "patriotic socialism", and the necessity of anti-imperialist politics.  A very fun conversation!</p> <p>Danny Haiphong is a journalist acting as Contributing Editor of Black Agenda Report, Co-Host of The Left Lens, and co-editor of Friends of Socialist China!  You can follow Danny on twitter @SpiritofHo and support him and his work at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/radiofreeamanda.">https://www.patreon.com/dannyhaiphong</a> </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at <a href= "mailto:guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com" target="_blank" rel= "noopener noreferrer">guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com</a>.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!     <item>
      <title>Art and the Working Class w/ Taylor Genovese</title>
      <itunes:title>Art and the Working Class w/ Taylor Genovese</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 20 Jan 2022 20:18:31 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[bb7d9766-ea9f-4b2d-909d-a1bb3a8a55e5]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/art-and-the-working-class-w-taylor-genovese]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>An unusual episode, but one that is a lot of fun and quite useful as well!  We have a returning guest, Taylor Genovese (see our episode on the Peasants' Revolt of 1381 to hear his previous appearance), AND a guest interviewer today, Safie Ashirova.  We talked about Alexander Bogdanov's Art and the Working Class, which Taylor has just translated into english for the very first time and has been released today at <a href= "http://peacelandbread.com/books" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">peacelandbread.com/books</a>.  A major examination on the necessity for proletarian art, and ideas of how to foster it, this is a book that everyone should check out (not least because the pdf version is free)!</p> <p>Taylor Genovese is a PhD researcher of anthropology at Arizona State University and an editorial board member of the fantastic journal Peace, Land, and Bread.  You can follow Taylor on twitter @trgenovese and on his website at <a href= "http://taylorgenovese.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">taylorgenovese.com</a>.  You can also follow Peace, Land, and Bread on twitter @PLBmagazine and on their website at <a href="http://peacelandbread.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener">peacelandbread.com</a>.</p> <p>Safie Ashirova is a Russian linguist and Russian literature aficionado.  She can be followed on twitter @sonja_tschka.</p> <p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>An unusual episode, but one that is a lot of fun and quite useful as well! We have a returning guest, Taylor Genovese (see our episode on the Peasants' Revolt of 1381 to hear his previous appearance), AND a guest interviewer today, Safie Ashirova. We talked about Alexander Bogdanov's Art and the Working Class, which Taylor has just translated into english for the very first time and has been released today at <a href= "http://peacelandbread.com/books" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">peacelandbread.com/books</a>. A major examination on the necessity for proletarian art, and ideas of how to foster it, this is a book that everyone should check out (not least because the pdf version is free)!</p> <p>Taylor Genovese is a PhD researcher of anthropology at Arizona State University and an editorial board member of the fantastic journal Peace, Land, and Bread. You can follow Taylor on twitter @trgenovese and on his website at <a href= "http://taylorgenovese.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">taylorgenovese.com</a>. You can also follow Peace, Land, and Bread on twitter @PLBmagazine and on their website at <a href="http://peacelandbread.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow noopener">peacelandbread.com</a>.</p> <p>Safie Ashirova is a Russian linguist and Russian literature aficionado. She can be followed on twitter @sonja_tschka.</p> <p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice. Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod. Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed! Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a> Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a> Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod. You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></content:encoded>
