    <item>
      <title>Socialist States &amp; the Environment w/ Salvatore Engel-Di Mauro</title>
      <itunes:title>Socialist States &amp;amp; the Environment w/ Salvatore Engel-Di Mauro</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 14 Jan 2022 08:22:12 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[d89d1aa8-df1a-4854-be0c-aa149afeee27]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/salvatore]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Professor Salvatore Engel-Di Mauro to talk about his book, <em>Socialist States and the Environment: Lessons for Eco-Socialist Futures</em>.  This book is an analytical and historical examination of the impact of Socialist States on the environment, and busts many myths that we hear in the imperialist core about this historical record.  A really deep dive of a conversation that will arm you with facts and historical perspective to combat the dual conservative/liberal propaganda against socialist states!</p> <p>Salvatore Engel-Di Mauro is Professor at the Geography Department of SUNY New Paltz and is chief editor for the journal <em>Capitalism Nature Socialism</em>.  His book <em>Socialist States and the Environment</em> is available from Pluto Press: <a href= "https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745340418/socialist-states-and-the-environment/"> https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745340418/socialist-states-and-the-environment/</a>.  You can also find the journal <em>Capitalism Nature Socialism</em> for more invaluable anti-capitalist environmental perspectives: <a href= "http://www.cnsjournal.org/">http://www.cnsjournal.org/</a>.  </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Professor Salvatore Engel-Di Mauro to talk about his book, <em>Socialist States and the Environment: Lessons for Eco-Socialist Futures</em>. This book is an analytical and historical examination of the impact of Socialist States on the environment, and busts many myths that we hear in the imperialist core about this historical record. A really deep dive of a conversation that will arm you with facts and historical perspective to combat the dual conservative/liberal propaganda against socialist states!</p> <p>Salvatore Engel-Di Mauro is Professor at the Geography Department of SUNY New Paltz and is chief editor for the journal <em>Capitalism Nature Socialism</em>. His book <em>Socialist States and the Environment</em> is available from Pluto Press: <a href= "https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745340418/socialist-states-and-the-environment/"> https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745340418/socialist-states-and-the-environment/</a>. You can also find the journal <em>Capitalism Nature Socialism</em> for more invaluable anti-capitalist environmental perspectives: <a href= "http://www.cnsjournal.org/">http://www.cnsjournal.org/</a>. </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>. Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod. Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>. </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>Dispatch: January 6 Anniversary</title>
      <itunes:title>Dispatch: January 6 Anniversary</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 06 Jan 2022 21:30:01 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[def2bd43-bb8c-4cd0-b4ec-8b21ac5b82c2]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/dispatch-january-6-anniversary]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we talk about the anniversary of the Capital Riot on January 6, 2021.  This episode is a Dispatch, which is part of our series of shorter, more informal episodes that are rooted in more current events, but which aim to use lessons of history to analyze.  Here we talk about the fetishization of the event by liberals and the media, the significance of the underlying tensions that led to the event, as well as other odds and ends.  Hope you enjoy!</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we talk about the anniversary of the Capital Riot on January 6, 2021. This episode is a Dispatch, which is part of our series of shorter, more informal episodes that are rooted in more current events, but which aim to use lessons of history to analyze. Here we talk about the fetishization of the event by liberals and the media, the significance of the underlying tensions that led to the event, as well as other odds and ends. Hope you enjoy!</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.       <title>2021: Year In Review</title>
      <itunes:title>2021: Year In Review</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 31 Dec 2021 09:43:23 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[99379d59-44b7-4443-b721-2c78c093a7db]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/2021-year-in-review]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>This Intelligence Briefing is a patron early access episode where the guys get together to discuss and analyze the most significant events of 2021.  A lot has happened in the past year, and we had a lot of fun chatting about some things that have been on the forefront of our minds, as well as some things that we had forgotten happened.  Hope you enjoy!</p> <p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>

    <item>
      <title>China, and the "Western Left" w/ Immanuel Ness (IB Part 2)</title>
      <itunes:title>China, and the &quot;Western Left&quot; w/ Immanuel Ness</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 24 Dec 2021 09:17:56 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[0ed0c08d-a421-4352-9666-4f8b404f3ecb]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/china-and-the-western-left-w-immanuel-ness-ib-part-2]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>We have another fun Intelligence Briefing this time, with a special guest!  For this conversation that takes a look at China, and once again takes aim at the "Western Left", we bring back our good friend and comrade Professor Immanuel Ness.  Manny is Professor of Political Science at Brooklyn College of the City University of New York and a Visiting Professor at the University of Johannesburg.  His latest book is Organizing Insurgency: Workers' Movements in the Global South, which is available from Pluto Press: <a href= "https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745343594/organizing-insurgency/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745343594/organizing-insurgency/.</a>   You can follow him on twitter @ImmanuelNess.</p> <p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>We have another fun Intelligence Briefing this time, with a special guest!     <item>
      <title>Peasants' Revolt of 1381 w/ Taylor Genovese</title>
      <itunes:title>Peasants&#39; Revolt of 1381 w/ Taylor Genovese</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 10 Dec 2021 08:42:11 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[9deadd6b-4805-46c7-ab22-e9e1ad8e248b]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/peasants-revolt-of-1381-w-taylor-genovese]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>We get medieval in this episode, and we're joined by a special guest!  The topic of this conversation is the English Peasants' Revolt of 1381, and we are joined by the fantastic Taylor Genovese for the episode.  We talk about the historical context of the Revolt, the events of it, as well as its impacts.  A very interesting discussion, and one that we were very happy that Taylor could join us for!</p> <p>Taylor Genovese is a PhD researcher of anthropology at Arizona State University (where his PhD work is supervised by, among others, none other than Alexander Aviña).  He is also an editorial board member of the fantastic journal Peace, Land, and Bread, which all Guerrilla History listeners should check out.  You can follow Taylor on twitter @trgenovese and on his website at <a href="http://taylorgenovese.com/" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">taylorgenovese.com</a>.  You can also follow Peace, Land, and Bread on twitter @PLBmagazine and on their website at <a href="http://peacelandbread.com/" target= "_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">peacelandbread.com</a>.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>

    <item>
      <title>The Battle of Dien Bien Phu w/ Comrade Luna</title>
      <itunes:title>The Battle of Dien Bien Phu w/ Comrade Luna</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 26 Nov 2021 09:12:10 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[0f6d4e50-af28-49b1-92ab-87876075aee6]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/luna]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we talk to a very special guest, one whom many of you are probably familiar with-Comrade Luna of the YouTube channel LunaOi!  We discuss the Battle of Dien Bien Phu and its impacts both within Vietnam as well as in liberation struggles globally.  Definitely something we've all been wanting to discuss!</p> <p>Comrade Luna is a Vietnamese communist living in Hanoi.  She runs the YouTube channel LunaOi (<a href= "https://t.co/ibUYXNtQlg?amp=1">https://t.co/ibUYXNtQlg?amp=1</a>), which covers Vietnamese foods, culture, and travel, as well as communist theory and political discussion.  Well worth checking out!  You can also follow Luna on twitter @LunaOi_VN, and support her on patreon by going to <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/lunaoi">https://www.patreon.com/lunaoi</a>.    </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>

      <title>Amerithrax at 20 w/ Robbie Martin</title>
      <itunes:title>Amerithrax at 20 w/ Robbie Martin</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Mon, 22 Nov 2021 09:39:34 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[76a097a8-e36e-45c4-a2bd-a743f21d4e3d]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/amerithrax-at-20-w-robbie-martin]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>We have another fun Intelligence Briefing this time, with a special guest!  For this conversation to mark the 20th anniversary of the Amerithrax case, we bring onto the show Robbie Martin from Media Roots Radio, who has been doing a tremendous amount of research into the topic.  </p> <p>Robbie Martin (alongside his sister Abby) is one of the two cohosts of Media Roots Radio, a show they've been doing since 2010 with a critical eye on American politics and imperialism.  You can listen to Media Roots's public episodes wherever you get your podcasts, and you can support them and get bonus content by subscribing to their patreon: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/mediarootsradio.">https://www.patreon.com/mediarootsradio.</a>  You can follow Robbie on twitter @FluorescentGrey and Media Roots @MediaRootsNews.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>

    <item>
      <title>COP26 Dispatch w/ Vijay Prashad and Chris Saltmarsh</title>
      <itunes:title>COP26 Dispatch w/ Vijay Prashad and Chris Saltmarsh</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 18 Nov 2021 05:30:40 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[fe61b2c6-ebb1-43a9-b4da-89e6d1369eff]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/cop26-dispatch-w-vijay-prashad-and-chris-saltmarsh]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, Adnan facilitates a discussion about the recently wrapped up COP26 climate conference, its failures, and what we should look to do going forward!  We are calling this a "Dispatch" as it's a shorter, more "in the moment" episode to ground us for current events.  Our guests are Vijay Prashad, Executive Director of the Tricontinental Institute for Social Research, who was at COP26, and Chris Saltmarsh, co-founder of Labour for a Green New Deal, climate activist, and writer.</p> <p>Vijay Prashad is the author of many books, including <em>The Darker Nations</em>, <em>The Poorer Nations</em>, and <em>Washington Bullets</em>.  He was also the first guest on Guerrilla History, so be sure to go back and check out the episode we did with him on <em>Washington Bullets</em>!  Follow him on twitter @vijayprashad.  Chris Saltmarsh is the author of the new book <em>Burnt: Fighting for Climate Justice</em>, and regularly writes about the climate.  His two newest articles in <em>Tribune are 2.4 Degrees Is a Disaster-But COP Won't Stop It</em>, and <em>COP26 Can Learn From West Papua's Green Resistance</em>.  You can follow Chris on twitter @Chris_Saltmarsh.</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, Adnan facilitates a discussion about the recently wrapped up COP26 climate conference, its failures, and what we should look to do going forward! We are calling this a "Dispatch" as it's a shorter, more "in the moment" episode to ground us for current events. Our guests are Vijay Prashad, Executive Director of the Tricontinental Institute for Social Research, who was at COP26, and Chris Saltmarsh, co-founder of Labour for a Green New Deal, climate activist, and writer.</p> <p>Vijay Prashad is the author of many books, including <em>The Darker Nations</em>, <em>The Poorer Nations</em>, and <em>Washington Bullets</em>. He was also the first guest on Guerrilla History, so be sure to go back and check out the episode we did with him on <em>Washington Bullets</em>! Follow him on twitter @vijayprashad. Chris Saltmarsh is the author of the new book <em>Burnt: Fighting for Climate Justice</em>, and regularly writes about the climate. His two newest articles in <em>Tribune are 2.4 Degrees Is a Disaster-But COP Won't Stop It</em>, and <em>COP26 Can Learn From West Papua's Green Resistance</em>. You can follow Chris on twitter @Chris_Saltmarsh.</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.       <title>Anniversary Livestream w/ Gerald Horne</title>
      <itunes:title>Anniversary Livestream w/ Gerald Horne</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 07 Nov 2021 17:50:08 +0000</pubDate>

      <description><![CDATA[<p>For this special episode of Guerrilla History, we celebrated our one year anniversary by hosting a livestream featuring returning guest and fan favorite, Dr. Gerald Horne!  We covered a lot in this conversation, from Texas and the historical roots of US fascism, the need for Cuban solidarity, recent books and movies that have caught Dr. Horne's eye, and more!  If you haven't already heard our previous episode with him on The Counterrevolution of 1776, be sure to scroll back in your podcast feed and check that out too, as some of these themes are connected.</p> <p>Gerald Horne is the John J. and Rebecca Moores Chair of History and African American Studies at the University of Houston.  His research interests are unbelievably varied, encompassing biographies of W.E.B. Du Bois and Paul Robeson, to The Haitian Revolution, to Hollywood in the '30s-'50s, to Jazz and Justice.  Be sure to check out his bibliography, you're certain to find something that interests you!</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>

      <description><![CDATA[<p>Guerrilla History is celebrating its one year anniversary!</p> <p>Join us for our inaugural livestream on Saturday, November 6 at 6pm Eastern Time, with special guest Dr. Gerald Horne!  The livestream can be viewed on the Revolutionary Left Radio youtube channel <a href= "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGz5KS3SlLJHSVc4HtYH3QA">https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGz5KS3SlLJHSVc4HtYH3QA</a>.  Be sure to subscribe and set your notifications on!  The audio will also be uploaded onto our general feed for podcast listeners.</p> <p>For those able to support the show monetarily, we will be hosting a short meet and greet after we wrap up the livestream with those contributing at the $10 tier or higher on our patreon.  If this sounds like something you'd like to do, and you'd like to chip in, you can join us here: <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.</p> <p>Hope to see you there!</p>]]></description>

      <title>USAID: Crossover with Radio Free Amanda</title>
      <itunes:title>USAID: Crossover with Radio Free Amanda</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 29 Oct 2021 08:53:01 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[69fda381-f7d1-4883-a21c-fe118b593ac8]]></guid>

      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this special crossover episode of Guerrilla History, we collaborate with friend of the show Amanda Yee and her podcast Radio Free Amanda to discuss the history and somewhat covert imperialism of USAID.  This is a conversation that was very interesting to do the background research before, and was a very fun conversation in itself!</p> <p>Amanda Yee is an activist and the creator of the podcast Radio Free Amanda.  Her show focuses on topics such as imperialism, media criticism, and more.  The show is very new, and we are hoping to help get the word out about it!  You can follow Amanda on twitter @catcontentonly and support her and her show at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/radiofreeamanda.">https://www.patreon.com/radiofreeamanda.</a> </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at <a href= "mailto:guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com" target="_blank" rel= "noopener noreferrer">guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com</a>.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href="https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href="https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.</p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>

    <item>
      <title>Dispatch: The Pandora Papers w/ Branko Marcetic</title>
      <itunes:title>Dispatch: The Pandora Papers w/ Branko Marcetic</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 22 Oct 2021 05:54:30 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[3f0ac848-5e38-46db-be11-c6b2a8239a04]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/dispatch-the-pandora-papers-w-branko-marcetic]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we host a crash course and discussion on the recently leaked Pandora Papers, the political impact of them, and their provenance!  We are calling this a "Dispatch" as it's a shorter, more "in the moment" episode to ground us for current events.  Our guest is Branko Marcetic, writer at Jacobin Magazine and author of the new article <em>CIA Op or Not, the Pandora Papers Are a Big Deal</em>.</p> <p>Branko Marcetic is a staff writer at Jacobin Magazine and the author of the book <em>Yesterday's Man: The Case Against Joe Biden</em> (Verso Books).  You can read his work for Jacobin, which is compiled here: <a href= "https://www.jacobinmag.com/author/branko-marcetic?__cf_chl_managed_tk__=pmd_lI6_GpQJFtFB4rr09QEWFBODkM1bLZd4qFjYo7Mp8sA-1634881856-0-gqNtZGzNAzujcnBszQd9"> https://www.jacobinmag.com/author/branko-marcetic?__cf_chl_managed_tk__=pmd_lI6_GpQJFtFB4rr09QEWFBODkM1bLZd4qFjYo7Mp8sA-1634881856-0-gqNtZGzNAzujcnBszQd9</a>.  You can follow Branko on twitter @BMarchetich.  Also look for his podcast about New Zealand and international politics, 1/200 Podcast (on twitter @1of200podcast, and wherever you get your pods).</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we host a crash course and discussion on the recently leaked Pandora Papers, the political impact of them, and their provenance! We are calling this a "Dispatch" as it's a shorter, more "in the moment" episode to ground us for current events. Our guest is Branko Marcetic, writer at Jacobin Magazine and author of the new article <em>CIA Op or Not, the Pandora Papers Are a Big Deal</em>.</p> <p>Branko Marcetic is a staff writer at Jacobin Magazine and the author of the book <em>Yesterday's Man: The Case Against Joe Biden</em> (Verso Books). You can read his work for Jacobin, which is compiled here: <a href= "https://www.jacobinmag.com/author/branko-marcetic?__cf_chl_managed_tk__=pmd_lI6_GpQJFtFB4rr09QEWFBODkM1bLZd4qFjYo7Mp8sA-1634881856-0-gqNtZGzNAzujcnBszQd9"> https://www.jacobinmag.com/author/branko-marcetic?__cf_chl_managed_tk__=pmd_lI6_GpQJFtFB4rr09QEWFBODkM1bLZd4qFjYo7Mp8sA-1634881856-0-gqNtZGzNAzujcnBszQd9</a>. You can follow Branko on twitter @BMarchetich. Also look for his podcast about New Zealand and international politics, 1/200 Podcast (on twitter @1of200podcast, and wherever you get your pods).</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>. Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod. Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>. </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>Electoral Theory and Strategy of Marx and Lenin w/ August Nimtz</title>
      <itunes:title>Electoral Theory and Strategy of Marx and Lenin w/ August Nimtz</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 15 Oct 2021 09:15:49 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[5c6e7387-76fd-41bd-aa6f-5213d5940536]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/nimtz]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Professor August Nimtz to talk about his book, <em>The Ballot, The Streets, or Both? From Marx and Engels to Lenin and the October Revolution</em>.  This book takes a look at the theoretical and strategic groundings and evolution of electoralism via the writings of Marx/Engels and Lenin.  A conversation that will add a lot of historical nuance to the debates that we have every election season in the "western democratic" countries!</p> <p>August Nimtz professor of political science and African American and African studies at the University of Minnesota.  His book <em>The Ballot, The Streets, or Both?</em> is available from Haymarket Books: <a href= "https://www.haymarketbooks.org/books/1385-the-ballot-the-streets-or-both"> https://www.haymarketbooks.org/books/1385-the-ballot-the-streets-or-both</a>.  His other books include <em>Marx and Engels: Their Contribution to the Democratic Breakthrough</em> (SUNY Press), <em>Marx, Tocqueville, and Race in America: The 'Absolute Democracy' or 'Defiled Republic'</em> <em> </em>(Lexington Books), and <em>Marxism versus Liberalism: Comparative Real-Time Political Analysis</em> (Palgrave Macmillan).  </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href=       <pubDate>Fri, 01 Oct 2021 08:02:08 +0000</pubDate>

      <description><![CDATA[<div class="sc-1sp3zau-0 kVdvan sc-1di2uql-0 iwStOA" data-tag= "post-content"> <p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>We have another fun Intelligence Briefing this time, with a special guest!  For this wide ranging conversation about, among other things, the irrelevance of the Western left and US imperialism, we bring back our good friend and comrade Professor Immanuel Ness.  </p> <p>Manny is Professor of Political Science at Brooklyn College of the City University of New York and a Visiting Professor at the University of Johannesburg.  His latest book is Organizing Insurgency: Workers' Movements in the Global South, which is available from Pluto Press: <a href= Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your       <title>Jose Maria Sison: In Conversation with Comrade Joma</title>
      <itunes:title>Jose Maria Sison: In Conversation with Comrade Joma</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 17 Sep 2021 18:05:43 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[f9db8424-4d96-46ae-a3ca-3069ed47310b]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/joma]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Professor Jose Maria Sison, better known as Comrade Joma, to talk about his life, how it impacted his ideology, the history of the Communist Party of the Philippines, and more!  Comrade Joma is an absolute legendary figure, and it was a pleasure and an honor to be able to talk with him.  A must listen conversation for anyone interested in proletarian struggles and People's War in the Global South, especially the Philippines!</p> <p>Jose Maria Sison is the Founding Chairman of the Communist Party of the Philippines, Chair Emeritus of the International League of People's Struggle, and the Chief Political Consultant of the National Democratic Front of the Philippines.  He's written extensively, a great place to find some of his works is via our friends at Foreign Languages Press.  They have several of his works available for free as pdfs or for affordable print copies on their website <a href= "https://foreignlanguages.press/">https://foreignlanguages.press/</a>. </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>

    <item>
      <title>Dispatch: Coup in Guinea w/ Abayomi Azikiwe</title>
      <itunes:title>Dispatch: Coup in Guinea w/ Abayomi Azikiwe</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Mon, 06 Sep 2021 19:56:52 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[9908190f-dc19-4602-899d-c91f94e23896]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/dispatch-coup-in-guinea-w-abayomi-azikiwe]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we host a crash course on Guinean history to help provide context on the ongoing coup unfolding!  We are calling this a "Dispatch" as it's a shorter, more "in the moment" episode to ground us for current events.  Our guest is Abayomi Azikiwe, editor of Pan-African News Wire.</p> <p>Abayomi Azikiwe is the editor of Pan-African News Wire, and has had writings featured in numerous outlets.  Read Pan-African News Wire by visiting <a href= "http://panafricannews.blogspot.com/">http://panafricannews.blogspot.com/</a>.  You can follow Abayomi on twitter @panafnewswire. You can also find him on facebook at <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/panafricannewswire">https://www.facebook.com/panafricannewswire</a> or on instagram at <a href= "https://www.instagram.com/abayomiazikiwe/?hl=en">https://www.instagram.com/abayomiazikiwe/?hl=en</a>.</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we host a crash course on Guinean history to help provide context on the ongoing coup unfolding! We are calling this a "Dispatch" as it's a shorter, more "in the moment" episode to ground us for current events. Our guest is Abayomi Azikiwe, editor of Pan-African News Wire.</p> <p>Abayomi Azikiwe is the editor of Pan-African News Wire, and has had writings featured in numerous outlets. Read Pan-African News Wire by visiting <a href= "http://panafricannews.blogspot.com/">http://panafricannews.blogspot.com/</a>. You can follow Abayomi on twitter @panafnewswire.       <title>Eco-Despair, Revolutionary Optimism, and the Fight for the Future: Part 1-Intelligence Briefing</title>

      <description><![CDATA[<p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>This Intelligence Briefing is the first half of a wide ranging conversation on apathy and hopelessness as a result of the climate crisis, how we maintain our revolutionary optimism, and chat about our fight for the future!  This half will be available as an early release to our Patreon members, the second half will be exclusive to comrades on Patreon.  We hope that this conversation gives you a bit of optimism and perhaps a bit of fire to continue the struggle for the future.  We have a world to win!</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!       <title>Modern Bolivian History w/ Ollie Vargas</title>

      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Ollie Vargas to talk about the recent history of Bolivia.  This is an expansive episode that aims to provide historical grounding of Bolivia so that we can better understand current events taking place there!</p> <p>Ollie Vargas is a Bolivian reporter at Kawsachun News, and has covered Bolvian politics, news, and the recent coup for other outlets such as The Grayzone, teleSUR English, Morning Star, and Mintpress News.  You can follow Ollie on twitter @OVargas52. You can find Kawsachun News via twitter @KawsachunNews or on their website <a href="kawsachunnews.com">kawsachunnews.com</a>. "patreon.com/KawsachunNews">patreon.com/KawsachunNews</a>.</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki,     <item>
      <title>Workers Movements in the Global South w/ Immanuel Ness</title>
      <itunes:title>Workers Movements in the Global South w/ Immanuel Ness</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Jul 2021 10:49:01 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[7451aa64-2180-45e4-9ddf-3a589bfa8077]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/ness]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Professor Immanuel Ness to talk about his brand new book, <em>Organizing Insurgency: Workers Movements in the Global South</em>.  The book combines theory of workers movements with case studies from India, South Africa, and the Philippines.  A must listen conversation for an internationalist proletarian understanding of workers power!</p> <p>Immanuel Ness is Professor of Political Science at Brooklyn College of the City University of New York and Senior Research Associate at the University of Johannesburg.  His book <em>Organizing Insurgency</em> is available from Pluto Press: <a href= "https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745343594/organizing-insurgency/">https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745343594/organizing-insurgency/</a>.  His other books include <em>Southern Insurgency: The Coming of the Global Working Class</em> (Pluto Press), <em>Urban Revolt: State Power and the Rise of People's Movements in the Global South </em>(Haymarket Books), and <em>The Palgrave Encyclopedia of Imperialism and Anti-Imperialism</em> (Palgrave Macmillan).  He is also the editor of the  Journal of Labor and Society (Brill).  Lots of stuff to check out!  Manny can be found on twitter @ImmanuelNess.</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Professor Immanuel Ness to talk about his brand new book, <em>Organizing Insurgency: Workers Movements in the Global South</em>. The book combines theory of workers movements with case studies from India, South Africa, and the Philippines. A must listen conversation for an internationalist proletarian understanding of workers power!</p> <p>Immanuel Ness is Professor of Political Science at Brooklyn College of the City University of New York and Senior Research Associate at the University of Johannesburg. His book <em>Organizing Insurgency</em> is available from Pluto Press: <a href= "https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745343594/organizing-insurgency/">https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745343594/organizing-insurgency/</a>. His other books include <em>Southern Insurgency: The Coming of the Global Working Class</em> (Pluto Press), <em>Urban Revolt: State Power and the Rise of People's Movements in the Global South </em>(Haymarket Books), and <em>The Palgrave Encyclopedia of Imperialism and Anti-Imperialism</em> (Palgrave Macmillan). He is also the editor of the Journal of Labor and Society (Brill). Lots of stuff to check out! Manny can be found on twitter @ImmanuelNess.</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>. Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod. Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>. </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>A Decolonial Feminism w/ Françoise Vergès</title>
      <itunes:title>A Decolonial Feminism w/ Françoise Vergès</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 09 Jul 2021 12:23:08 +0000</pubDate>

      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/a-decolonial-feminism]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this special crossover episode of Guerrilla History with The Red Menace Podcast, we bring on Dr. Françoise Vergès to talk about her new book <em>A Decolonial Feminism</em>.  An incredible conversation with a tremendous guest, you're definitely going to want to pick up this short but powerful work and form reading groups with it!</p> <p>Françoise Vergès is an activist, public educator, and is the author of many books including <em>Resolutely Black: Conversations with Aime Cesaire</em> (Polity, 2019), <em>The Wombs of Women: Race, Capital, Feminism and Monsters</em> and <em>Revolutionaries: Colonial Family Romance and Metissage</em> (Duke University Press, 2020, 1999).  Her newest book, <em>A Decolonial Feminism</em>, is available from Pluto Press (<a href= "https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745341125/a-decolonial-feminism/">https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745341125/a-decolonial-feminism/</a>).</p> <p>You can find The Red Menace Podcast wherever you get your pods, or directly at <a href= "https://redmenace.libsyn.com/">https://redmenace.libsyn.com/</a>.  You can follow the show on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href=     <item>
      <title>Intelligence Briefing:  UFOs</title>
      <itunes:title>Intelligence Briefing:  UFOs</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 02 Jul 2021 15:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[ebe3b15d-ad8e-4be1-80f0-28b4b56d8a07]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/intelligence-briefing-ufos]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>This Intelligence Briefing will be a patreon-early access episode, all about UFOs!  We talk about the prospects for extraterrestrial life, what is actually on the government's UFO tapes, and what UFOs would want if they were indeed real.  A thought provoking and fun discussion all around!</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>

      <title>Tea War w/ Andrew Liu</title>
      <itunes:title>Tea War w/ Andrew Liu</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 18 Jun 2021 14:23:58 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[474d4a18-5854-4f67-aa0c-b1d6d6141a32]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/andrew-b-liu]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Professor Andrew Liu to talk about his book Tea War: A History of Capitalism in China and India.  A fascinating discussion about capitalist development in the periphery through the story of a commodity, be sure to get the word out!</p> <p>Andrew Liu is an assistant professor of history at Villanova University, where his research focuses on China, transnational Asia, and the history of Capitalism.  His book Tea War is available from Yale University Press: <a href= "https://yalebooks.yale.edu/book/9780300243734/tea-war">https://yalebooks.yale.edu/book/9780300243734/tea-war</a>.  The discount code he mentions during the interview is <span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> YAB99. </span> You can find Andrew's podcast Time to Say Goodbye wherever you get your pods, or at <a href= "https://goodbye.substack.com/">https://goodbye.substack.com/</a> and on twitter @ttsgpod. Andrew himself can be found on twitter @andybliu.</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>

      <title>Intelligence Briefing: Vaccine Intellectual Property Rights</title>
      <itunes:title>Intelligence Briefing: Vaccine Intellectual Property Rights</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 11 Jun 2021 13:45:38 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[6d60b7bc-1bb9-4b45-b55d-6dd827725a96]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/intelligence-briefing-vaccine-intellectual-property-rights]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>This Intelligence Briefing will be a patreon-early access episode, about vaccine intellectual property rights.  Here we talk some history, some current events, and overall just rant back and forth.  A very fun conversation for each of us!</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice. Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>This Intelligence Briefing will be a patreon-early access episode, about vaccine intellectual property rights. Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod. Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed! Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a> Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a> Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.       <title>The History of Indigenous Resistance w/ Nick Estes</title>
      <itunes:title>The History of Indigenous Resistance w/ Nick Estes</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 21 May 2021 15:50:43 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[daa8d313-2aee-49f6-bace-1213ae824ca6]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/nick-estes]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on professor, activist, and author Nick Estes to talk to us about the long history of American indigenous resistance.  The conversation is structured around Nick's brilliant book Our History Is the Future:  Standing Rock Versus the Dakota Access Pipeline, and the Long Tradition of Indigenous Resistance.</p> <p>Nick Estes is a citizen of the Lower Brule Sioux Tribe. He's also an Assistant Professor of American Studies at the University of New Mexico, an organizer with The Red Nation, and author of the aforementioned Our History Is the Future, which is available from Verso Books:  <a href= "https://www.versobooks.com/books/2953-our-history-is-the-future">https://www.versobooks.com/books/2953-our-history-is-the-future</a>.  You can find The Red Nation via their website <a href= "http://therednation.org/">http://therednation.org/</a> and on twitter @The_Red_Nation. Nick can be found on twitter @nickwestes.</p> <p>Breht has previously recorded a couple of episodes of Revolutionary Left Radio with Nick as well.  You can find those on your podcast app of choice, or via the following links:</p> <p><a href= "https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/lakota-and-dakota-history"> https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/lakota-and-dakota-history</a></p> <p><a href= "https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/aim">https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/aim</a></p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></description>
