      <title>Intelligence Briefing:  The One Kingdom Solution?</title>
      <itunes:title>Intelligence Briefing:  The One Kingdom Solution?</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Tue, 18 May 2021 00:16:21 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[ed9eaff2-c68d-4897-86e9-aa58b220f24b]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/intelligence-briefing-the-one-kingdom-solution]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>This Intelligence Briefing will be an early-release episode for our patreon members, about a fantastic essay by Adnan and Professor Margaret Pappano titled "The One Kingdom Solution?:  Diplomacy, Marriage, and Sovereignty In The Third Crusade".  Here, we talk about the story of a proposed cross-confessional marriage during the Third Crusade as a diplomatic tool, and weave in the current situation in Palestine using this information.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;"> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools--container"> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-copy" title="Copy">  </div> <div class="highlighter--separator"> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-change-color" title="Change Color"> </div> <div class="highlighter--separator"> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-delete" title= "Delete"> </div> </div> </div>]]></description>

      <title>Burma's History &amp; Rohingya Tragedy w/ Carlos Sardiña Galache</title>
      <itunes:title>Burma&#39;s History &amp;amp; Rohingya Tragedy w/ Carlos Sardiña Galache</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 23 Apr 2021 16:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[32b0866e-f9fb-4060-8a94-53a544dfc18a]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/carlos]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on journalist Carlos Sardiña Galache to discuss the history of Burma/Myanmar and the tragedy of the Rohingya people.  Given the recent coup and subsequent violence perpetuated against protestors, we feel that this is a vitally important interview to orient the events within the overall flow of Burmese History.</p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Carlos Sardiña Galache is the author of The Burmese Labyrinth: A History of the Rohingya Tragedy (Verso Books, <a href= "https://www.versobooks.com/books/3152-the-burmese-labyrinth">https://www.versobooks.com/books/3152-the-burmese-labyrinth</a>).  He has also published articles in a variety of outlets focusing on Myanmar, including New Left Review, Jacobin, Time Magazine, the Intercept, and the Asia Times.  All of his articles can be found on his website (<a href= "http://carlossardina.pressfolios.com/">http://carlossardina.pressfolios.com/</a>)  You can follow him on twitter @CSGalache.</span></p> <p>Henry has also conducted two interviews with Carlos on the David Feldman Show, focusing on the recent events in Myanmar.  You can find those interviews (which should make good supplementary material) here: </p> <p>Interview 1 (starts at 4:04:30): <a href= "https://youtu.be/jwgygIWJyV0?t=14670" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://youtu.be/jwgygIWJyV0?t=14670</a></p> <p>Interview 2 (starts at 1:16:40): <a href= "https://youtu.be/-1n4KjXIeHU?t=4600" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://youtu.be/-1n4KjXIeHU?t=4600</a></p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</span></p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;"> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools--container"> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-copy"     <item>
      <title>*UNLOCKED* Intelligence Briefing: 1793 French Constitution</title>
      <itunes:title>*UNLOCKED* Intelligence Briefing: 1793 French Constitution</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Apr 2021 22:27:07 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[16962bf8-b442-449a-b1c7-b6996265e1f2]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/unlocked-intelligence-briefing-1793-french-constitution]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<div class="stackable mb-xs"> <div class="sc-1n9tf3q-0 jNyQIK"> <div class="sc-jrAGrp iHFFOn"><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</span></div> </div> </div> <div class="sc-1sp3zau-0 kVdvan sc-1di2uql-0 iwStOA" data-tag= "post-content"> <p>This Intelligence Briefing will be an early-release episode for our patreon members, about the radical French Constitution of 1793, which was never implemented despite being ratified.  The guys discuss the historical context for this document, how it compares to US documents of the same period, and how it compares to the much more conservative French Constitution of 1795, which was implemented.  Here are links to read the French Constitutions of 1793 and 1795, in english:</p> <p>1793- <a href= "https://oll.libertyfund.org/page/1793-french-republic-constitution-of-1793" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://oll.libertyfund.org/page/1793-french-republic-constitution-of-1793</a> </p> <p>1795- <a href= "https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/The_Constitutions_and_Other_Select_Documents_Illustrative_of_the_History_of_France,_1789%E2%80%931907/50" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://en.wikisource.org/wiki/The_Constitutions_and_Other_Select_Documents_Illustrative_of_the_History_of_France,_1789%E2%80%931907/50</a> </p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> </div> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;"> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools--container"> <div       <content:encoded><![CDATA[Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice. Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings. <p>This Intelligence Briefing will be an early-release episode for our patreon members, about the radical French Constitution of 1793, which was never implemented despite being ratified. The guys discuss the historical context for this document, how it compares to US documents of the same period, and how it compares to the much more conservative French Constitution of 1795, which was implemented.     <item>
      <title>Cold War Latin America w/ Alexander Aviña</title>
      <itunes:title>Cold War Latin America w/ Alexander Aviña</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 26 Mar 2021 14:45:52 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[18bdb7e7-4e55-4c9d-9310-1c9a23c0adbf]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/alex-avia]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Rev Left Radio fan favorite Professor Alexander Aviña to talk about Latin America in the Cold War period.  While we in the global north tend to think of the Cold War period as being typified by tensions in Eastern Europe, Latin America was the playground for much of the US's conflicts of the era.  </p> <p>Alexander Aviña is historian at Arizona State University, and is author of the book Specters of Revolution:  Peasant Guerrilla in the Cold War Mexican Countryside (Oxford University Press, 2014, <a href= "https://alexanderavina.com/specters-of-revolution/">https://alexanderavina.com/specters-of-revolution/</a> ).  He has also had articles published in places like NACLA Report of the Americas and the Journal of Iberian and Latin America Research, and has made numerous interview appearances, including several episodes of Revolutionary Left Radio.  You can follow him on twitter @Alexander_Avina.</p> <p> </p> <p><span style= "font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Open Sans', 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;"> Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</span></p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;"> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools--container"> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-copy" title="Copy">  </div> <div class="highlighter--separator"> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-change-color" title="Change Color"> </div> <div class="highlighter--separator"> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-delete" title= "Delete"> </div> </div> </div>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we bring on Rev Left Radio fan favorite Professor Alexander Aviña to talk about Latin America in the Cold War period. While we in the global north tend to think of the Cold War period as being typified by tensions in Eastern Europe, Latin America was the playground for much of the US's conflicts of the era. </p> <p>Alexander Aviña is historian at Arizona State University, and is author of the book Specters of Revolution: Peasant Guerrilla in the Cold War Mexican Countryside (Oxford University Press, 2014, <a href= "https://alexanderavina.com/specters-of-revolution/">https://alexanderavina.com/specters-of-revolution/</a> ). He has also had articles published in places like NACLA Report of the Americas and the Journal of Iberian and Latin America Research, and has made numerous interview appearances, including several episodes of Revolutionary Left Radio. You can follow him on twitter @Alexander_Avina.</p> <p> </p> <p> Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>. Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod. Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>. </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>*UNLOCKED* Intelligence Briefing: Right Wing Conspiracies</title>
      <itunes:title>*UNLOCKED* Intelligence Briefing: Right Wing Conspiracies</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 26 Feb 2021 01:26:44 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[ed2ae7ef-ba42-4f34-92b0-cf97723fee4a]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/unlocked-intelligence-briefing-right-wing-conspiracies]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>This Intelligence Briefing will be an patreon early access episode, about the psychological, historical, and material underpinnings of right wing conspiracies.  While the majority of the references specifically are regarding QAnon, this episode tackles right wing conspiracies more generally.</p> <p>Lewandowski's Conspiracy Theory Handbook <a href= "https://www.climatechangecommunication.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/ConspiracyTheoryHandbook.pdf" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.climatechangecommunication.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/ConspiracyTheoryHandbook.pdf</a></p> <p>Altemeyer's The Authoritarians: <a href= "https://theauthoritarians.org/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://theauthoritarians.org/</a></p> <p> </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at <a href= "mailto:guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com">guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com</a>. </p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;"> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools--container"> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-copy" title="Copy">  </div> <div class="highlighter--separator"> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-change-color" title="Change Color"> </div> <div class="highlighter--separator"> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-delete" title= "Delete"> </div> </div> </div>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice. Patrons at the Comrade tier and above will have access to all Intelligence Briefings.</p> <p>This Intelligence Briefing will be an patreon early access episode, about the psychological, historical, and material underpinnings of right wing conspiracies. While the majority of the references specifically are regarding QAnon, this episode tackles right wing conspiracies more generally.</p> <p>Lewandowski's Conspiracy Theory Handbook <a href= "https://www.climatechangecommunication.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/ConspiracyTheoryHandbook.pdf" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.climatechangecommunication.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/ConspiracyTheoryHandbook.pdf</a></p> <p>Altemeyer's The Authoritarians: <a href= "https://theauthoritarians.org/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://theauthoritarians.org/</a></p> <p> </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at <a href= "mailto:guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com">guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com</a>. </p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed! Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a> Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a> Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod. You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>BONUS:  Malcolm X Assassination</title>
      <itunes:title>BONUS:  Malcolm X Assassination</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 26 Feb 2021 01:26:26 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[cdca1bc8-70ac-4774-968e-fc808ef8da61]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/bonus-malcolm-x-assassination]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>This bonus episode of Guerrilla History comes out on the 56th anniversary of the assassination of Malcolm X, and also comes out less than 24 hours after the unsealing of a deathbed confession related to the assassination.  We plan on doing several Malcolm X specific episodes in the future, but for the commemoration of this anniversary, we focus today primarily on the assassination.</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at <a href= "mailto:guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com">guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com</a>. </p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!  Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href="https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target= "_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod.  You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;"> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools--container"> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-copy" title="Copy">  </div> <div class="highlighter--separator"> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-change-color" title="Change Color"> </div> <div class="highlighter--separator"> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-delete" title= "Delete"> </div> </div> </div>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This bonus episode of Guerrilla History comes out on the 56th anniversary of the assassination of Malcolm X, and also comes out less than 24 hours after the unsealing of a deathbed confession related to the assassination. We plan on doing several Malcolm X specific episodes in the future, but for the commemoration of this anniversary, we focus today primarily on the assassination.</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at <a href= "mailto:guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com">guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com</a>. </p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed! Please encourage your comrades to join us, which will help our show grow.</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a> Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href="https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target= "_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a> Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod. You can find and support these shows by visiting <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a></p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>The Counterrevolution of 1776 w/ Gerald Horne</title>
      <itunes:title>The Counterrevolution of 1776 w/ Gerald Horne</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 26 Feb 2021 01:17:09 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[14854dac-ed14-4bf0-a2c4-a0736e1cc9ff]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/gerald-horne]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we close out Black History Month with a very special guest, the great Professor Gerald Horne. In this episode, we talk about heroic creation myths of the United States, and the actual history in order to deconstruct these myths.  This episode will be largely based on Gerald's books The Counterrevolution of 1776:  Slave Resistance and the Origins of the United States, The Dawning of the Apocalypse:  The Roots of Slavery, White Supremacy, Settler Colonialism, and Capitalism in the Long 16th Century, and The Apocalypse of Settler Colonialism:  The Roots of Slavery, White Supremacy, and Capitalism in 17th Century North America and the Caribbean.  </p> <p>Gerald Horne is the John J. and Rebecca Moores Chair of History and African American Studies at the University of Houston.  His research interests are unbelievably varied, encompassing biographies of W.E.B. Du Bois and Paul Robeson, to The Haitian Revolution, to Hollywood in the '30s-'50s, to Jazz and Justice.  Be sure to check out his bibliography, you're certain to find something that interests you!</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;"> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools--container"> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-copy" title="Copy">  </div> <div class="highlighter--separator"> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-change-color" title="Change Color"> </div> <div class="highlighter--separator"> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-delete" title= "Delete"> </div> </div> </div>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we close out Black History Month with a very special guest, the great Professor Gerald Horne. In this episode, we talk about heroic creation myths of the United States, and the actual history in order to deconstruct these myths. This episode will be largely based on Gerald's books The Counterrevolution of 1776: Slave Resistance and the Origins of the United States, The Dawning of the Apocalypse: The Roots of Slavery, White Supremacy, Settler Colonialism, and Capitalism in the Long 16th Century, and The Apocalypse of Settler Colonialism: The Roots of Slavery, White Supremacy, and Capitalism in 17th Century North America and the Caribbean. </p> <p>Gerald Horne is the John J. and Rebecca Moores Chair of History and African American Studies at the University of Houston. His research interests are unbelievably varied, encompassing biographies of W.E.B. Du Bois and Paul Robeson, to The Haitian Revolution, to Hollywood in the '30s-'50s, to Jazz and Justice. Be sure to check out his bibliography, you're certain to find something that interests you!</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>. Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod. Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>. </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>Intro to African Revolutions and Decolonization w/ Leo Zeilig</title>
      <itunes:title>Intro to African Revolutions and Decolonization w/ Leo Zeilig</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 05 Feb 2021 16:42:13 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[10d74919-6ccc-473b-b488-ca57d4f2c2b3]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/leo-zeilig]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we do a survey on African revolutions and decolonization movements so that we can dive deep into individual African movements/revolutions in the future, and call back to this episode for the broader regional/continental historical context.  For this herculean task, we bring on Leo Zeilig, an editor of the <em>Review of African Political Economy,</em> a senior research fellow at the Institute of Commonwealth Studies at the School of Advanced Study University of London, and an Honorary Research Associate at the Society, Work and Development Institute (SWOP) at the University of the Witwatersrand, South Africa.</p> <p>Leo's books include Thomas Sankara (HSRC Press), Frantz Fanon: Philosopher of the Third World (I.B. Tauris), African Struggles Today: Social Movements Since Independence (Haymarket), and Congo: Plunder and Resistance (Zed Books).  You can find his website at <a href="https://leozeilig.com/">https://leozeilig.com/</a> and follow him on twitter @LeoZeilig.  Also, follow the Review of African Political Economy on twitter @ROAPEJournal and their website <a href= "https://roape.net/">https://roape.net/</a> .</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod.  Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href="https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;"> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools--container"> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-copy" title="Copy">  </div> <div class="highlighter--separator"> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-delete" title= "Delete"> </div> </div> </div> <div highlighter--icon-copy" title="Copy">  </div> <div class="highlighter--separator"> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-delete" title= "Delete"> </div> </div> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-delete" title= "Delete"> </div> </div> </div>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we do a survey on African revolutions and decolonization movements so that we can dive deep into individual African movements/revolutions in the future, and call back to this episode for the broader regional/continental historical context. For this herculean task, we bring on Leo Zeilig, an editor of the <em>Review of African Political Economy,</em> a senior research fellow at the Institute of Commonwealth Studies at the School of Advanced Study University of London, and an Honorary Research Associate at the Society, Work and Development Institute (SWOP) at the University of the Witwatersrand, South Africa.</p> <p>Leo's books include Thomas Sankara (HSRC Press), Frantz Fanon: Philosopher of the Third World (I.B. Tauris), African Struggles Today: Social Movements Since Independence (Haymarket), and Congo: Plunder and Resistance (Zed Books). You can find his website at <a href="https://leozeilig.com/">https://leozeilig.com/</a> and follow him on twitter @LeoZeilig. Also, follow the Review of African Political Economy on twitter @ROAPEJournal and their website <a href= "https://roape.net/">https://roape.net/</a> .</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>. Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod. Follow and support these shows on patreon, and find them at <a href="https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/</a>. </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>How the West Stole Democracy from the Arabs w/ Elizabeth Thompson</title>
      <itunes:title>How the West Stole Democracy from the Arabs w/ Elizabeth Thompson</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 15 Jan 2021 16:21:13 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[5f191b3a-fe38-4b09-ae16-04304e3a203c]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/elizabeth-thompson]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we are joined by Professor Elizabeth F. Thompson to talk about her new book How the West Stole Democracy from the Arabs, about the historic Syrian-Arab Congress of 1920.  Professor Thompson is the Mohamed S. Farsi Chair of Islamic Peace and Professor of History at American University.  Her book was published by Atlantic Monthly Press, and is available here: <a href= "https://groveatlantic.com/book/how-the-west-stole-democracy-from-the-arabs/"> https://groveatlantic.com/book/how-the-west-stole-democracy-from-the-arabs/</a>    </p> <p> </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and on Libsyn at <a href= "https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,">https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,</a> and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod and on Libsyn <a href= "https://redmenace.libsyn.com/">https://redmenace.libsyn.com/</a>.  You can support those two podcasts by visiting by going to patreon and donating to RevLeft Radio and The Red Menace.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;"> highlighter--icon-delete" title= "Delete"> </div> </div> </div>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we are joined by Professor Elizabeth F. Thompson to talk about her new book How the West Stole Democracy from the Arabs, about the historic Syrian-Arab Congress of 1920. Professor Thompson is the Mohamed S. Farsi Chair of Islamic Peace and Professor of History at American University.     <item>
      <title>*Unlocked*  Intelligence Briefing- MK Ultra ft. Michelle Shephard</title>
      <itunes:title>*Unlocked*  Intelligence Briefing- MK Ultra ft. Michelle Shephard</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 08 Jan 2021 15:06:12 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[124696a0-2133-4da5-99ac-3a0bb22ebfb8]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/unlocked-intelligence-briefing-mk-ultra-ft-michelle-shephard]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<div class="_2TO-components-SimpleRichTextEditor--paragraphElement" data-block="true" data-editor="32itf" data-offset-key="ab11p-0-0"> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="ab11p-0-0"><span data-offset-key= "ab11p-0-0">Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Vanguard tier and above will get instant access to all episodes.  Half of the episodes will be made available to the public after a week or two, while the others will remain patreon-exclusives (though they will be opened up to members of the Comrade tier after a couple weeks).</span></div> </div> <div class="_2TO-components-SimpleRichTextEditor--paragraphElement" data-block="true" data-editor="32itf" data-offset-key="597u2-0-0"> <div class= "public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="597u2-0-0"><span data-offset-key="597u2-0-0">This Intelligence Briefing was an early release on patreon, and is a bit different format than usual.  Our topic today is MK Ultra, and after we have a brief chat back and forth about the CIA's mind control project, we include an interview Henry conducted with Michelle Shephard on The David Feldman Show (a twice weekly podcast hosted by a leftist comedy writer, which Adnan and Henry regularly feature on, and Breht has been a guest on several times).  Michelle is a Canadian journalist who recently created the CBC podcast miniseries Brainwashed, about MK Ultra with a focus on the Canadian component of the project.  If you enjoy that interview, subscribe to The David Feldman Show wherever you get podcasts (and check out his website at</span> <a class= "_4X_-components-SimpleRichTextEditor-components-LinkSpan--linkSpan" href="https://davidfeldmanshow.com/)"><span data-offset-key=       <content:encoded><![CDATA[Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice. Patrons at the Vanguard tier and above will get instant access to all episodes. Half of the episodes will be made available to the public after a week or two, while the others will remain patreon-exclusives (though they will be opened up to members of the Comrade tier after a couple weeks). This Intelligence Briefing was an early release on patreon, and is a bit different format than usual. Our topic today is MK Ultra, and after we have a brief chat back and forth about the CIA's mind control project, we include an interview Henry conducted with Michelle Shephard on The David Feldman Show (a twice weekly podcast hosted by a leftist comedy writer, which Adnan and Henry regularly feature on, and Breht has been a guest on several times). Michelle is a Canadian journalist who recently created the CBC podcast miniseries Brainwashed, about MK Ultra with a focus on the Canadian component of the project. If you enjoy that interview, subscribe to The David Feldman Show wherever you get podcasts (and check out his website at <a class= "_4X_-components-SimpleRichTextEditor-components-LinkSpan--linkSpan" href="https://davidfeldmanshow.com/)">https://davidfeldmanshow.com/)</a> and follow him on twitter @david_feldman_. Also, subscribe to Brainwashed on your podcast app of choice, and follow Michelle on twitter @shephardm. Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea. Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod. Your contributions on patreon (<a class= "_4X_-components-SimpleRichTextEditor-components-LinkSpan--linkSpan" href="https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>) make the show possible to continue and succeed! To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a class= "_4X_-components-SimpleRichTextEditor-components-LinkSpan--linkSpan" href="https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a> Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a class= "_4X_-components-SimpleRichTextEditor-components-LinkSpan--linkSpan" href="https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a> Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod. You can find all the information regarding these shows, and contribute to them, by visiting <a class= "_4X_-components-SimpleRichTextEditor-components-LinkSpan--linkSpan" href= "https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/">https://www.revolutionaryleftradio.com/.</a> Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>Women in Nepal's Civil War w/ Hisila Yami</title>
      <itunes:title>Women in Nepal&#39;s Civil War w/ Hisila Yami</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 18 Dec 2020 16:56:12 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[dd372a05-ef87-4375-8ab8-91010d7a072d]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/women-in-nepals-civil-war]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we are joined by Hisila Yami to talk about The People's War in Nepal, and the role of women in it. Hisila Yami was a leader in The People's War, a three times minister of Nepal, a former member of the Constituent Assembly, and the author of People's War and Women's Liberation in Nepal.  She can be followed on twitter @HisilaPost.   </p> <p> </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and on Libsyn at <a href= "https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,">https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,</a> and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod and on Libsyn <a href= "https://redmenace.libsyn.com/">https://redmenace.libsyn.com/</a>.  You can support those two podcasts by visiting by going to patreon and donating to RevLeft Radio and The Red Menace.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;">       <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we are joined by Hisila Yami to talk about The People's War in Nepal, and the role of women in it. Hisila Yami was a leader in The People's War, a three times minister of Nepal, a former member of the Constituent Assembly, and the author of People's War and Women's Liberation in Nepal. She can be followed on twitter @HisilaPost. </p> <p> </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/the-majlis">https://anchor.fm/the-majlis,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.     <item>
      <title>John Brown:  Cross-Over w/ RevLeft Radio</title>
      <itunes:title>John Brown:  Cross-Over w/ RevLeft Radio</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Mon, 07 Dec 2020 18:03:24 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[b3c93f46-fae6-4759-be89-92bc12c5354e]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/john-brown]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>This episode of Guerrilla History is a cross-over episode with Revolutionary Left Radio, hosted by our cohost Breht O'Shea.  </p> <p>In this episode, we discuss the life, legacy, tactics, and lessons from the legendary John Brown.  For background reading on one of the most famous and controversial abolitionists, we recommend starting with W.E.B. Du bois's "John Brown", published in 1909, and David Reynold's "John Brown, Abolitionist", published in 2005.</p> <p> </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens,">https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and on Libsyn at <a href= "https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,">https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,</a> and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod and on Libsyn <a href= "https://redmenace.libsyn.com/">https://redmenace.libsyn.com/</a>.  You can support those two podcasts by visiting by going to patreon and donating to RevLeft Radio and The Red Menace.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;"> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools--container"> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-copy" title="Copy">  </div> <div class="highlighter--separator"> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-delete" title= "Delete"> </div> </div> </div>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This episode of Guerrilla History is a cross-over episode with Revolutionary Left Radio, hosted by our cohost Breht O'Shea. </p> <p>In this episode, we discuss the life, legacy, tactics, and lessons from the legendary John Brown. For background reading on one of the most famous and controversial abolitionists, we recommend starting with W.E.B. Du bois's "John Brown", published in 1909, and David Reynold's "John Brown, Abolitionist", published in 2005.</p> <p> </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present. If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens,">https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>. Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and on Libsyn at <a href= "https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,">https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,</a> and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod and on Libsyn <a href= "https://redmenace.libsyn.com/">https://redmenace.libsyn.com/</a>. You can support those two podcasts by visiting by going to patreon and donating to RevLeft Radio and The Red Menace. </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p>]]></content:encoded>

    <item>
      <title>*UNLOCKED* Intelligence Briefing:  A Brief History of Vaccine Flubs</title>
      <itunes:title>*UNLOCKED* Intelligence Briefing:  A Brief History of Vaccine Flubs</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 27 Nov 2020 16:10:01 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[21b619ce-6f38-4055-8a35-401a502cfa26]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/unlocked-intelligence-briefing-a-brief-history-of-vaccine-flubs]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>This Intelligence Briefing has been unlocked from our Patreon.  It was originally published on 13 November.</p> <p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice.  Patrons at the Vanguard tier and above will get instant access to all episodes.  Half of the episodes will be made available to the public after a week or two, while the others will remain patreon-exclusives (though they will be opened up to members of the Comrade tier after a couple weeks). </p> <p>This Intelligence Briefing is a conversation about some examples of vaccines gone wrong in the past, timely considering the recent news of the Pfizer vaccine candidate's efficacy results in Phase 3 Trials (and since recording, the Moderna and Oxford/AstraZeneca vaccines as well).  This episode will be the one this month that will be released to the public.  </p> <p>Here is the link to Henry's video he mentioned: <a href= "https://youtu.be/bXCAYrPhCSc" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://youtu.be/bXCAYrPhCSc</a></p> <p>As well as a second video he made after this Intelligence Briefing was recorded: <a href= "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X9hNYhnM71s">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X9hNYhnM71s</a> </p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod.  Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p> </p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a>  Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href="https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a>   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and on Libsyn at <a href= "https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,</a> and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod and on Libsyn <a href= "https://redmenace.libsyn.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://redmenace.libsyn.com/.</a>  You can support those two podcasts by visiting <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/RevLeftRadio">https://www.patreon.com/RevLeftRadio</a> and <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/TheRedMenace.">https://www.patreon.com/TheRedMenace.</a>  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> <p> </p> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;"> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools--container"> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-copy" title="Copy">  </div> <div class="highlighter--separator"> </div> <div class="highlighter--icon highlighter--icon-delete" title= "Delete"> </div> </div> </div>]]></description>
      
      <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>This Intelligence Briefing has been unlocked from our Patreon. It was originally published on 13 November.</p> <p>Guerrilla History- Intelligence Briefings will be roughly a twice monthly series of shorter, more informal discussions between the hosts about topics of their choice. Patrons at the Vanguard tier and above will get instant access to all episodes. Half of the episodes will be made available to the public after a week or two, while the others will remain patreon-exclusives (though they will be opened up to members of the Comrade tier after a couple weeks). </p> <p>This Intelligence Briefing is a conversation about some examples of vaccines gone wrong in the past, timely considering the recent news of the Pfizer vaccine candidate's efficacy results in Phase 3 Trials (and since recording, the Moderna and Oxford/AstraZeneca vaccines as well). This episode will be the one this month that will be released to the public. </p> <p>Here is the link to Henry's video he mentioned: <a href= "https://youtu.be/bXCAYrPhCSc" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://youtu.be/bXCAYrPhCSc</a></p> <p>As well as a second video he made after this Intelligence Briefing was recorded: <a href= "https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X9hNYhnM71s">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X9hNYhnM71s</a> </p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod. Your contributions make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p> </p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995.</a> Adnan can be followed on twitter at @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href="https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/.</a> Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and on Libsyn at <a href= "https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/," target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,</a> and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at @Red_Menace_Pod and on Libsyn <a href= "https://redmenace.libsyn.com/" target="_blank" rel= "nofollow noopener">https://redmenace.libsyn.com/.</a> You can support those two podcasts by visiting <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/RevLeftRadio">https://www.patreon.com/RevLeftRadio</a> and <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/TheRedMenace.">https://www.patreon.com/TheRedMenace.</a> </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> <p> </p>]]></content:encoded>

      <title>Why Turkey Is Authoritarian w/ Halil Karaveli</title>
      <itunes:title>Why Turkey Is Authoritarian w/ Halil Karaveli</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 20 Nov 2020 15:29:48 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[eb65b723-a00c-4902-8d0c-518d5d5a1f83]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/episode-2]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we are joined by Halil Karaveli to talk about Why Turkey Is Authoritarian. Halil M. Karaveli is a Senior Fellow with the Turkey Center of the Central Asia-Caucasus Institute & Silk Road Studies Program Joint Center and editor of its publication The Turkey Analyst.  His book Why Turkey Is Authoritarian:  From Atatürk to Erdoğan is available from Pluto Books.</p> <p>Follow The Turkey Analyst's coverage at <a href= "https://www.turkeyanalyst.org/">https://www.turkeyanalyst.org/</a>.  Why Turkey Is Authoritarian can be bought from Pluto Books using this link <a href= "https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745337555/why-turkey-is-authoritarian/"> https://www.plutobooks.com/9780745337555/why-turkey-is-authoritarian/</a>. </p> <p> </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens,">https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and on Libsyn at <a href= "https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,">https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,</a> and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod and on Libsyn <a href= "https://redmenace.libsyn.com/">https://redmenace.libsyn.com/</a>.  You can support those two podcasts by visiting by going to patreon and donating to RevLeft Radio and The Red Menace.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork, and Kevin MacLeod, who creates royalty-free music.</p> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;">       <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, we are joined by Halil Karaveli to talk about Why Turkey Is Authoritarian. Halil M. Karaveli is a Senior Fellow with the Turkey Center of the Central Asia-Caucasus Institute & Silk Road Studies Program Joint Center and editor of its publication The Turkey Analyst. His book Why Turkey Is Authoritarian: From Atatürk to Erdoğan is available from Pluto Books.</p> <p>Follow The Turkey Analyst's coverage at <a href= "https://www.turkeyanalyst.org/">https://www.turkeyanalyst.org/</a>.       <title>Washington Bullets w/ Vijay Prashad</title>
      <itunes:title>Washington Bullets w/ Vijay Prashad</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 07 Nov 2020 03:19:37 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[a6c25208-3fe0-4def-a627-f21b3090a2d5]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/why-turkey-is-authoritarian]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>In this episode of Guerrilla History, the guys run through some of the long and sordid history of US interventions abroad, whether by the military, the CIA, the IMF, or other even less thought about methods.  The very special guest is Vijay Prashad, Director of the Tricontinental Institute for Social Research and author of (among many other vital works) the new book Washington Bullets. </p> <p>Vijay can be followed on twitter @vijayprashad and the Tricontinental Institute can be followed @tri_continental.  Washington Bullets is available from LeftWord books for a very low price!  You can find it here <a href= "https://mayday.leftword.com/catalog/product/view/id/21820">https://mayday.leftword.com/catalog/product/view/id/21820.</a></p> <p> </p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.  If you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p> </p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter @guerrilla_pod, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter @huck1995, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter @adnanahusain, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href=
