"https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter @RevLeftRadio and on Libsyn at <a href= "https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,">https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,</a> and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter @Red_Menace_Pod and on Libsyn <a href= "https://redmenace.libsyn.com/">https://redmenace.libsyn.com/</a>.  You can support those two podcasts by visiting <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/RevLeftRadio">https://www.patreon.com/RevLeftRadio</a> and <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/TheRedMenace">https://www.patreon.com/TheRedMenace</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks     <item>
      <title>Guerrilla History Pilot</title>
      <itunes:title>Guerrilla History Pilot</itunes:title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 07 Nov 2020 03:01:44 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid isPermaLink="false"><![CDATA[d635e50e-af24-4357-8ad7-15c0cabd9f4a]]></guid>
      <link><![CDATA[https://guerrillahistory.libsyn.com/guerrilla-history-pilot]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[<p>Welcome to the Guerrilla History Podcast's pilot episode!</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>In this pilot episode, the guys run through what the vision and goals of this podcast will be, as well as some topics that we hope to cover in the near future.  We hope that the discussion will be useful to you, and if you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at <a href= "mailto:guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com">guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com</a>.</p> <p>Follow us on social media!  Our podcast can be found on twitter at <a href= "https://twitter.com/guerrilla_pod">https://twitter.com/guerrilla_pod</a>, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>.  Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter at <a href= "https://twitter.com/huck1995">https://twitter.com/huck1995</a>, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>.  Adnan can be followed on twitter at <a href= "https://twitter.com/adnanahusain">https://twitter.com/adnanahusain</a>, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens,">https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>.   Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter at <a href= "https://twitter.com/RevLeftRadio">https://twitter.com/RevLeftRadio</a> and on Libsyn at <a href= "https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,">https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,</a> and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at <a href= "https://twitter.com/Red_Menace_Pod">https://twitter.com/Red_Menace_Pod</a> and on Libsyn <a href= "https://redmenace.libsyn.com/">https://redmenace.libsyn.com/</a>.  You can support those two podcasts by visiting <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/RevLeftRadio">https://www.patreon.com/RevLeftRadio</a> and <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/TheRedMenace">https://www.patreon.com/TheRedMenace</a>.  </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork.</p> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools" style="display: none;"> <div id="highlighter--hover-tools--container"> <div       <content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Welcome to the Guerrilla History Podcast's pilot episode!</p> <p>Guerrilla History is the podcast that acts as a reconnaissance report of global proletarian history, and aims to use the lessons of history to analyze the present.</p> <p>Your hosts are immunobiologist Henry Hakamaki, Professor Adnan Husain, historian and Director of the School of Religion at Queens University, and Revolutionary Left Radio's Breht O'Shea.</p> <p>In this pilot episode, the guys run through what the vision and goals of this podcast will be, as well as some topics that we hope to cover in the near future. We hope that the discussion will be useful to you, and if you have any questions or guest/topic suggestions, email them to us at <a href= "mailto:guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com">guerrillahistorypod@gmail.com</a>.</p> <p>Follow us on social media! Our podcast can be found on twitter at <a href= "https://twitter.com/guerrilla_pod">https://twitter.com/guerrilla_pod</a>, and can be supported on patreon at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory">https://www.patreon.com/guerrillahistory</a>. Your contributions will make the show possible to continue and succeed!</p> <p>To follow the hosts, Henry can be found on twitter at <a href= "https://twitter.com/huck1995">https://twitter.com/huck1995</a>, and also has a patreon to help support himself through the pandemic where he breaks down science and public health research and news at <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/huck1995">https://www.patreon.com/huck1995</a>. Adnan can be followed on twitter at <a href= "https://twitter.com/adnanahusain">https://twitter.com/adnanahusain</a>, and also runs The Majlis Podcast, which can be found at <a href= "https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens,">https://anchor.fm/msgp-queens,</a> and the Muslim Societies-Global Perspectives group at Queens University, <a href= "https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/">https://www.facebook.com/MSGPQU/</a>. Breht is the host of Revolutionary Left Radio, which can be followed on twitter at <a href= "https://twitter.com/RevLeftRadio">https://twitter.com/RevLeftRadio</a> and on Libsyn at <a href= "https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,">https://revolutionaryleftradio.libsyn.com/,</a> and cohost of The Red Menace Podcast, which can be followed on twitter at <a href= "https://twitter.com/Red_Menace_Pod">https://twitter.com/Red_Menace_Pod</a> and on Libsyn <a href= "https://redmenace.libsyn.com/">https://redmenace.libsyn.com/</a>. You can support those two podcasts by visiting <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/RevLeftRadio">https://www.patreon.com/RevLeftRadio</a> and <a href= "https://www.patreon.com/TheRedMenace">https://www.patreon.com/TheRedMenace</a>. </p> <p> </p> <p>Thanks to Ryan Hakamaki, who designed and created the podcast's artwork.</p>]]></content:encoded>
